children.definition: Ep. (and Ion., if rightly read in Hp.) dat. pl. forms of ὅδε. [Accent varies in codd.; in Od. 13.258 most codd. and Eust. have τοῖσδεσσι, and Hdn.Gr. 2.155 prescribes τοίσδεσσι.]
overseer of the rowers on each side of the ship, boatswain, Artem. 1.35, 2.23; written tutarchus in Gloss.

definition: τοιχάς, άδος, ἡ, in pl., epith. of ships in Nonn. D. 39.7 ( στοιχάδας Ludwich).
τοιχίδιον, τό, Dim. of τοῖχος, Anon. Prog. ap. Rh. 1.642 W.

children.definition: lie on her beam ends, Ach.Tat. 3.1, Eust. 1021.12.

definition: τοιχίον, τό, Dim. of τοῖχος, IG 14.894.

children.definition: of a wall, παραστάματα BCH 20.324 (Lebad.).
walker on walls, Cat.Cod.Astr. 8(4).215.
a writing or painting on a wall, Aret. CA 1.2; the art of wall-painting, St.Byz. s.v. Βοῦρα.
one who creeps through a hole in the wall (in order to steal), and so = τοιχωρύχος, Hsch.
build walls, IG 7.422 ( Oropus, iv B. C.).
top of a wall, coping, Ph. Bel. 83.19.
possess the concept or idea of a wall, Plu. Col. 2.1120d, 1121a; cf. ἱππόομαι.

definition: τοιχοποιία, ἡ, = τειχοποιία (which is v.l.), Ph. Bel. 81.34.

children.definition: cupboard in a wall, armarium, EM 147.5 (v.l. -πυργίους).
Phot., Suid.

wall of a house or enclosure, abs., Od. 2.342, Ar. V. 130, etc.; ἅπαντʼ ἐρευνῶν τ. dub. in E. Hec. 1174; τ. δώματος Il. 16.212; μεγάροιο 18.374, cf. Od. 19.37; τ. καὶ θριγκοί (of the αὐλή) 17.267, cf. Hes. Op. 732; τὸν τῆς αὐλῆς τ. PEnteux. 12.3 (iii B. C.); wall of a temple, IG 1(2).372.51, al.; οἰκίας Pl. R. 574d; ἐν τοῖσι τ. ἔγραφʼ Ἀθηναῖοι καλοί Ar. Ach. 144, cf. Pl. Lg. 859a; εἰς τὸν τ. ἀντεγγραψάτω IG 1(2).94.24; νόμους ἀναγράφειν εἰς τοῖχον Decr. ap. And. 1.84; κοινοὶ τ. party- walls, OGI 483.101, al. ( Pergam., ii A. D.); τοίχῳ προσιστάμενοι γυμνάζονται Gal. 6.144: of the side of a tent or hut, Il. 9.219, 24.598, E. Ion 1158.

data.quote: ἐν τοῖσι τ. ἔγραφʼ Ἀθηναῖοι καλοί

children.label: b
children.definition: τοῖχε κεκονιαμένε, as a term of abuse, Act.Ap. 23.3.
sides of a ship, Od. 12.420, Thgn. 674, E. Hel. 1573, Th. 7.36, Theoc. 22.12; τοίχου ἄρχω τοῦ δεξιοῦ Luc. DMeretr. 14.3, cf. JTr. 49.
εἰς ἀμφοτέρους τοίχους (by metaph. from a ship) E. Tr. 118 (anap.), cf. Luc. Asin. 9; of a cup, Pherecr. 143.2; of a vessel, Arist. Mete. 359a3; of a bath ( πύελος), Gal. 15.709.

τοίχους τοὺς δύο ἐπαλείφειν ‘to run with the hare and hunt with the hounds’, Paus. 6.3.15, cf. Suid. s.v. δύο τοίχους; ὁ εὖ πράττων τ. ‘the snug side of the ship’, ‘the right side of the hedge’, Ar. Ra. 537 (lyr.); ἐς τὸν εὐτυχῆ τ. χωρεῖν E. Fr. 89. (Akin to τεῖχος, but used in a special sense; later = τεῖχος, LXX Is. 25.12, prob. so in JHS 24.39 ( Cyzicus).)
carry a wall on oneʼs head, perh. of Cybele or ἡ Τύχη τῆς πόλεως, IG 12(5).241 ( Paros, i B. C.).
dig through a wall like a thief, to be a housebreaker, Ar. Pl. 165, Pl. R. 575b. X. Mem. 1.2.62: c. acc., τοῖχον Arist. EN 1138a25.
οἷα ἐτοιχωρύχησαν περὶ τὸ δάνειον what thievish tricks they played with their loan, D. 35.9; τοὺς λόγους τινός Philostr. VS 2.1.6; πάντα Ph. 2.527.
hole dug in the wall, Phot., Suid.
thievish trick, Poll. 6.180.
housebreaking, X. Ap. 25, D.H. 4.24.
housebreakerʼs craft, S.E. M. 2.12.

one who digs through the wall, i.e. housebreaker, burglar, sts. as term of abuse, Ar. Nu. 1327, Ra. 773, Pl. 204, Amips. 24, etc.; τ. καὶ ἱερόσυλοι Pl. Lg. 831e: as Adj., of things, ὦ τοιχωρύχον λαγύνιον rascally, Diph. 3.1.
provided with a wall, κλίνη -ωτή, = lectus parietalis, prob. in Gloss. ( -ωιν etc. codd.).

definition: τόκα, Dor. for τότε, Pi. O. 6.66, N. 6.10, Epich. 147, Isyll. 7, SIG 527.99 ( Drerus, iii B. C.), Berl.Sitzb. 1927.159 ( Cyrene), etc.

children.definition: poultry-farming, PSI 1.101.5, PRyl. 213.53 (ii A. D.), etc.

definition: τοκάδερ ( Lacon. for τοκάδες) · ἔγκυοι, Hsch.

children.definition: usurula, Gloss.

of or for breeding, brood, σύες θήλειαι τοκάδες Od. 14.16, cf. PSI 4.379.21 (iii B. C.), PCair.Zen. 152 (iii B. C.), Plb. 12.4.8, etc.; φόρος χηνῶν τοκάδων PPetr. 3p.286 (iii B. C.); ὀρνείθων τελείων τοκάδων POxy. 1207.9 (ii A. D.); prolific, γυναῖκες Str. 4.1.2; τοκάδα τὴν κεφαλὴν ἔχει, of Zeus, Luc. DDeor. 12[9].1.

having just brought forth, Eub. 149; τ. λέαινα with cubs, E. Med. 187 (anap.); τ. κύνες with pups, Call. Dian. 89 ( τ. as Subst., mothers, AP 9.268 ( Antip. Thess.)); of goats, Theoc. 8.63: rarely of women, ὅσαι δὲ τοκάδες ἦσαν E. Hec. 1157; γενναίων τʼ ἐκ τοκάδων born from noble mothers, Id. Cyc. 42 (lyr.); τοκάδα τὰν . . Βάκχου his mother, Id. Hipp. 560 (lyr.); τ. κόνις oneʼs motherland, Lyc. 316.
to be near delivery, τοκῶσα Cratin. 449.
for breeding, ἰβιών, i.e. place for breeding ibises, BGU 1216.171 (ii B. C.).
childbirth, delivery, Hp. Aër. 4, etc.; including pregnancy, Arist. GA 748b22; μαστοὺς ἐν τ. ἐπαιρομένους Dsc. 4.68: pl., πεπειραμέναι τῶν τ. Sor. 1.70a, cf. 2.31; τοκετῶν βάσανος AP 9.311 ( Phil.).

one who begets, father, Hes. Th. 138, 155: generally, begetter, τέκνου τ. A. Eu. 659:—in Hom. and Hes. mostly in pl., parents, Od. 1.170, Hes. Op. 185, al. (in dual, τοκῆε δύω Od. 8.312); so in Trag., A. Pers. 580 (lyr.), al., E. Hec. 403, al. (not in S., exc. f.l. in El. 187 (lyr.)); also in Prose, Hdt. 1.122, 3.52, Th. 2.44, Lys. 2.75, X. Mem. 2.1.33, etc.; of animals, Nic. Th. 620, Al. 563.— Hom. and Hes. commonly have the Ep. forms τοκῆες, τοκῆας, τοκήων ( Il. 15.663, al., more rarely τοκέων ib. 660, 21.587); τοκεῦσι 4.477, al.; gen. τοκήων also in Alc. Supp. 25.12, Sapph. Supp. 5.10, A. Ag. 728 (lyr., dub. l.); dat. τοκέσι IG 3.1311.
parent, Heraclit. 74, elsewh. dub., Call. Iamb. 1.137, AP 7.79 ( Mel.), 408 ( Leon.).
having had children, Hp. Nat.Mul. 3; fertile, Id. Steril. 226.

lend on interest, D. 45.70; μὴ τοκίζειν πλέονος ἢ τριῶν ὀδελῶν τὰν μνᾶν τοῦ μηνὸς ϝεκάστου Schwyzer 324.6 ( Delph., iv B. C.); τ. τόκον practise usury, AP 11.309 ( Lucill.):— Pass., τοκίζεται αὐτῷ ἀργύριον Hyp. Fr. 273, cf. IG 9(1).694.12, 29 (Corc.).

data.quote: μὴ τοκίζειν πλέονος ἢ τριῶν ὀδελῶν τὰν μνᾶν τοῦ μηνὸς ϝεκάστου

children.definition: interest, Schwyzer 323 A 56 ( Delph., iv B. C.).
BGU 1212 D 26 (Ptolemaic royal edict).
the practice of usury, X. Vect. 4.6, Arist. Pol. 1258b25.

money-lender, usurer, IG 2(2).1554.69 (iv B. C.), Pl. Alc. 2.149e, PEnteux. 33.2 (iii B. C.) ; τ. κατὰ μικρὰ καὶ ἐπὶ πολλῷ Arist. EN 1121b34; lender, creditor, SIG 364.10, al. ( Ephesus, iii B. C.): fem. τοκ-ίστρια PTeb. 761.11 (iii B. C.).

data.quote: τ. κατὰ μικρὰ καὶ ἐπὶ πολλῷ

children.definition: practise usury, Plu. Aud.poet. 2.34d, Luc. Nec. 2, etc.
one who marks down his interest (orig. perh. by notching a piece of wood), usurer, Com.Adesp. 1165, Ph. 1.550, al., Plu. Aud.poet. 2.18e, Luc. Vit.Auct. 23, Alciphr. 1.26, etc.; cf. γλύφω II.
one who exacts interest, Com.Adesp. 1165.

childbirth, parturition, of women, Il. 19.119, h.Cer. 101, IG 42(1).121.15,17 ( Epid., iv B. C.), Herophil. ap. Sor. 2.53; of animals, Il. 17.5; πλὴν ὅταν τ. παρῇ S. Fr. 477; ποιεῖσθαι τὸν τ. Arist. HA 542a25, etc.: pl., τόκοισί τε ἀγόνοις γυναικῶν S. OT 26, cf. 173 (lyr.), E. Med. 1031, etc.

children.label: b
children.definition: the time of parturition, ὁ τ. τῆς γυναικός Hdt. 1.111; period of gestation, ἐνιαύσιος ὁ τ. Arist. GA 777b13.

children.label: c
children.definition: ἡ φύσις τοῦ παιδίου τοῦ ἐν τόκῳ in the foetal stage, Hp. Nat.Puer. tit. (as cited in Mul. 1.1).

children.label: II
children.definition: offspring, of men or animals, πάντων Ἀργείων ἐρέων γενεήν τε τόκον τε Il. 7.128, cf. 15.141; of an eagle, ἐλθὼν ἐξ ὄρεος, ὅθι οἱ γενεή τε τόκος τε Od. 15.175; μήλων τ. E. Cyc. 162; Οἰδίπον τ. his son, A. Th. 372, cf. 407, etc. (but also, daughter, θεὰ γεγῶσα καὶ θεοῦ πατρὸς τ. E. Andr. [1254]); fry of fish, Arist. HA 543a4; litter of pigs, πασῶν τῶν συῶν ἀπὸ τόκου χοῖρον λαμβάνειν X. Lac. 15.5.

data.quote: πάντων Ἀργείων ἐρέων γενεήν τε τόκον τε
ἐλθὼν ἐξ ὄρεος, ὅθι οἱ γενεή τε τόκος τε
θεὰ γεγῶσα καὶ θεοῦ πατρὸς τ.
πασῶν τῶν συῶν ἀπὸ τόκου χοῖρον λαμβάνειν

children.definition: produce of money lent, hence interest (cf. S. Fr. 477 (punningly), Sophr. 35, Pl. R. 555e, Arist. Pol. 1258b5), Pi. O. 10(11).9, etc.; τ. ἐπίτριτος, v. h.v.; τ. πεντώβολος interest at 5 obols per month on the mina, IG 11(2).146 B 17 ( Delos, iv B. C.); τ. πεντεκαιδέκατος, i. e. 100/15 = 6 2/3 %, SIG 672.23 ( Delph., ii B. C.); sg. and pl., IG 1(2).324.5, Ar. Nu. 18, 20, 34, etc.; τόκους ἀποδοῦναι ib. 739, etc.; κομίζεσθαι Pl. l.c., PEnteux. 32.13 (iii B. C.); λαμβάνειν ἀπό τινος Is. 8.35; ἀπολαμβάνειν Lys. 17.3; δανείζειν ἐπὶ τόκῳ Pl. Lg. 742c; ὀφείλειν ἐπὶ τόκῳ Isoc. 17.7; τόκοι τόκων compound interest, Ar. Nu. 1156; τόκος τόκου Thphr. Char. 10.10; τῶν τόκων ἔχων τόκους Men. 870:— Ar. plays on the double meaning of the word, Th. 843 sq.; so also Pl. R. 507a, Plu. Def.orac. 2.433e.

interest, [ γῄδιον] ὅτι λάβοι σπέρμα . . δικαίως ἀπεδίδου αὐτό τε καὶ τόκον X. Cyr. 8.3.38, cf. Philem. 231, 88.10; οἱ δʼ εἰς τὸ γῆρας ἀναβολὰς ποιούμενοι, οὗτοι προσαποτίνουσι τοῦ χρόνου τόκους Men. 235.9; offspring, ἢ τίκτων λόγους ἢ τὸν ἑτέρων τόκον λαμβάνων Lib. Or. 12.94; bringing forth, ib. 17.38.

data.quote: γῄδιον] ὅτι λάβοι σπέρμα . . δικαίως ἀπεδίδου αὐτό τε καὶ τόκον
οἱ δʼ εἰς τὸ γῆρας ἀναβολὰς ποιούμενοι, οὗτοι προσαποτίνουσι τοῦ χρόνου τόκους
ἢ τίκτων λόγους ἢ τὸν ἑτέρων τόκον λαμβάνων

children.definition: tōḵ, ( oppression), LXX Ps. 71 (72). 14, Je. 9.6. (edited from Supp.)
pay interest, ἐπʼ ἐννέα ὀβολοῖς D. 59.52.

definition: τολάριον, τό, dub. sens. in Dura4 100 (pl., iii A. D.); perh.

children.definition: = Lat. torale.

definition: τόλμα, ης, ἡ, also τόλμη, which Phryn. PS p.114 B. compares with πρύμνη for πρύμνα: but (apart from πρὸς τόλμην πεσεῖν S. Ichn. 11 (Pap.), which is not guaranteed by the metre) only the form τόλμᾰ (acc. τόλμᾰν, e. g. E. IT 862) occurs in Att. and Trag., E. Andr. 702, Ion 1264, Fr. 426 (in E. Ion 1416, ἥ γε τόλμα σου (cj. Jodrell) is the prob.l.), Th. 3.82, 6.59, Pl. La. 193d, R. 575a, Gal. 15.144, POxy. 1119.8 (iii A. D.), etc.; so in Ion., Hdt. 7.135; but τόλμη (nom.) in Clitarch. 35J., acc. τόλμην LXX Ju. 16.10(12) cod. Alex.: Dor. τόλμᾱ, Pi. O. 9.82, 13.11:—

children.definition: courage, hardihood, Pi. ll. cc., Hdt. 2.121.ζʹ, Trag. and Att. (v. supr.); τόλμα καλῶν courage for noble acts, Pi. N. 7.59; τῶνδε τόλμαν σχεθεῖν to have courage or nerve for this business, A. Pr. 16.

over-boldness, recklessness, Id. Ch. 1004 ( 996); πῶς οὖν . . ἐς τόδʼ ἂν τόλμης ἔβη; S. OT 125, cf. E. Ion 1264, etc.; τόλμης ἔργα κἀναισχυντίας Ar. Th. 702; τ. ἀλόγιστος Th. 3.82, cf. 6.59; τ. καὶ ἀναίδεια Antipho 3.3.5, Is. 6.46; θρασύτης καὶ τ. Pl. La. 197b; τ. καὶ ἀναισχυντία Id. Ap. 38d; ἡ ἄφρων τ. Id. La. 193d.

data.quote: πῶς οὖν . . ἐς τόδʼ ἂν τόλμης ἔβη;

children.label: II
children.definition: a bold or daring act, φίλτρα τόλμης τῆσδε A. Ch. 1029; τόλμας (gen.), ἃν ἔρεξα E. Andr. 838 (lyr.): pl., κακὰς δὲ τόλμας μήτʼ ἐπισταίμην ἐγώ S. Tr. 582, cf. Aj. 46; ἀνόσιοι πληγῶν τ. Pl. Lg. 881a, cf. Ep. 336d.

data.quote: κακὰς δὲ τόλμας μήτʼ ἐπισταίμην ἐγώ

children.label: III
children.definition: Pythag. name for 2, Anatol. ap. Theol.Ar. 8. (v. *τλάω.)

definition: τολμάω, Ion. τολμέω Hdt. 8.77; Dor. 2 sg. τολμῇς Theoc. 5.35: fut. τολμήσω S. El. 471, Dor. -ᾱσῶ Theoc. 14.67: pf. τετόλμηκα A. Pr. 333, Dor. -ᾱκα Pi. P. 5.117:— Med., Lys. Oxy. 1606.420 ( Bodl. Quarterly Record 5 (1928).303):—

children.definition: undertake, take heart either to do or bear anything terrible or difficult:

dare, endure, submit (v. *τλάω) , ἐνὶ φρεσὶ θυμὸς ἐτόλμα Il. 10.232; σὺ δʼ (sc. κραδίη) ἐτόλμας Od. 20.20; οὐδέ οἱ ἵπποι τόλμων Il. 12.51; ἐγὼ δʼ ἐτόλμησʼ A. Pr. 237, etc.; αἱ συμφοραὶ τοὺς ἡσυχίους τολμᾶν βιάζονται Antipho 3.2.1; τ. καὶ ἐκλογίζεσθαι Th. 2.40; τολμῶντες ἄνδρες ib. 43, cf. S. Tr. 583; χρὴ τολμᾶν . . ἐν ἄλγεσι κείμενον ἄνδρα Thgn. 555; τόλμα κακοῖσιν Id. 355, 1029; τόλμα S. Ph. 82; τόλμησον ib. 481: in part., τολμήσας . . παρέστη he took courage and . . , Plu. Cam. 22, cf. Ev.Marc. 15.43.

data.quote: αἱ συμφοραὶ τοὺς ἡσυχίους τολμᾶν βιάζονται
χρὴ τολμᾶν . . ἐν ἄλγεσι κείμενον ἄνδρα

children.definition: endure, undergo, τ. χρὴ τὰ διδοῦσι θεοί Thgn. 591, cf. E. Hec. 333, Pl. Lg. 872e.

children.label: II
children.definition: inf., to have the courage, hardihood, effrontery, cruelty, or the grace, patience, to do a thing in spite of any natural feeling, dare, or bring oneself, to do, εἰ . . τολμήσεις Διὸς ἄντα . . ἔγχος ἀεῖραι Il. 8.424, cf. 13.395, 17.68, Od. 9.332, S. Aj. 528, Ar. Nu. 550, Lys. 32.2, etc.; τόλμησον ὀρθῶς φρονεῖν A. Pr. 999, cf. Thgn. 81, 377, etc.; τ. κατακεῖσθαι submit to keep oneʼs bed, Hp. Fract. 10; τ. ἀποθανεῖν Ep.Rom. 5.7; οὐδὲ ἀπαιτούμενοι τὸν λόγον ἐτόλμησαν ἡμῖν δοῦναι PCair.Zen. 330.5 (iii B. C.).

data.quote: εἰ . . τολμήσεις Διὸς ἄντα . . ἔγχος ἀεῖραι
οὐδὲ ἀπαιτούμενοι τὸν λόγον ἐτόλμησαν ἡμῖν δοῦναι

children.definition: part., ἐτόλμα . . βαλλόμενος he submitted to be struck, Od. 24.162; τόλμα ἐρῶσα E. Hipp. 476, cf. Thgn. 442, E. HF 756.

πόλεμον τολμήσαντα undertaking, venturing on it, Od. 8.519; [ ἐσόδους] τετόλμακε Pi. P. 5.117; τ. πάντα, δεινά, ἔργον αἴσχιστον, etc., S. OC 761, E. IA 133 (anap.), Med. 695, etc.; ὦ πᾶν σὺ τολμήσασα καὶ πέρα S. Fr. 189; also τ. τὰ βέλτιστα Th. 3.56, 4.98; πικρὰν πεῖραν S. El. 471; v. τόλμημα:—hence in Pass., ο ἐτολμήθη πατήρ such things as my father had dared (or done) against him, E. El. 277; τοῦτο τετολμήσθω εἰπεῖν let us take courage to say this, Pl. R. 503b; τὰ τολμηθέντα J. AJ 2.3.1; αἱ τετολμημέναι ἐπίνοιαι Ph. 1.674; τὰ τετ. εἰς ἐμέ PGoodsp.Cair. 15.3 (iv A. D.).

data.quote: ὦ πᾶν σὺ τολμήσασα καὶ πέρα

children.definition: Act., τετολμηκυῖαι [λέξεις] daring expressions, Phld. Rh. 1.341 S.

definition: τολμήεις, Dor. τολμ-άεις [ᾱ] Pi. P. 4.89, εσσα, εν,

children.definition: enduring, steadfast, Od. 17.284; daring, bold, Il. 10.205, Pi. l.c.: Sup. contr. τολμήστατε (v.l. τολμίστατε) is f.l. in S. Ph. 984. The prose form is τολμηρός.

data.ref: S. Ph. 984. The prose form is

children.definition: adventure, enterprise, daring or shameless act, freq. in E. (not in A. or S.), mostly in pl., E. Or. 1064, Ba. 1222, al.: sg., Ph. 1676; τ. τολμᾶτον οὐκ ἀνασχετόν Ar. Pl. 419, cf. Th. 6.54, 7.43, Pl. Lg. 636c, etc.
a bold expression, Hermog. Inv. 4.12, Meth. 6.

τολμήεις, Antipho 3.3.1, And. 1.110, Lys. 7.19, etc.; οἱ τολμηρότατοι Isoc. 3.21; προθυμία τολμηροτάτη Th. 1.74; τὸ τ. τινῶν their hardihood, ib. 102; τὸ -ότερον your greater daring, Id. 2.87; τ. πολλὰ δρᾶν Arist. EN 1117a2; κἂν εἰ -ότερον εἰρῆσθαι Pl. Sph. 267d: also in Poets, E. Supp. 305, Ar. Nu. 445 (anap.), Bion 1.60; ἀνοίας οὐδὲν -ότερον Men. 738; opp. εὔτολμος, Id. Mon. 153. Adv. -ρῶς Th. 3.74, 83, X. Smp. 2.12, etc.: Comp. -ότερον Th. 4.126, Plb. 1.17.7, Ep.Rom. 15.15: Sup. -ότατα Poll. 3.136.
a reckless act, Pl. Def. 412c.
one must venture, etc., τάδʼ E. Med. 1051, Ion 1387, cf. Com.Adesp. 18.16D.: c. inf., E. IT 111: abs., ib. 121, Pl. Lg. 888a.
bold, venturous man, Th. 1.70, Ph. 2.72, J. AJ 20.9.1, Adam. 2.5; θυμὸς τ. AP 9.678.
Com.Adesp. 1166, Adam. 1.7, Agath. 1.4, 4.27.
Sup., Hippod. ap. Stob. 4.1.94.

definition: τολμητός, ή, όν, also ός, όν E. Hel. 816:—

children.definition: ventured, to be ventured, πὰν τόλμᾱτον Sapph. 2.17; ἔστʼ ἐκείνῳ πάντα . . τολμητά within the compass of his daring, S. Ph. 634, cf. Cratin. 324b; ἐλπὶς τ. E. l.c.
dare-devil, Theognost. Can.Prooem.
Phot., Suid.
of or for accomplishing, Hsch. ( Sup.).
wind off carded wool into a clew for spinning, Ar. Lys. 587 (anap.).

children.label: II
children.definition: wind off, achieve, accomplish, ἐγὼ δὲ δόλους τολυπεύω, of Penelopeʼs web (with a play on the literal sense), Od. 19.137; ἐπεὶ πόλεμον τολύπευσε 1.238, 4.490, al.; Θρῃξὶν πένθος τ. work them grief, E. Rh. 744 (anap.); δόμον τ. finish building it, AP 9.655; λίθον . . ἐκ θεμέθλων Arch.Anz. 31.149 ( Nicopolis).
endure, ἐς γῆρας τ. ἀργαλέους πολέμους Il. 14.86; ὁπόσα τολύπευσε σὺν αὐτῷ καὶ πάθεν ἄλγεα 24.7. (Poet. word, v.l. in J. AJ 17.1.2 for πολιτεύω.)

data.quote: ὁπόσα τολύπευσε σὺν αὐτῷ καὶ πάθεν ἄλγεα

children.definition: clew, ball of wool ready for spinning, or of spun yarn, S. Fr. 1102, Ar. Lys. 586 (anap.), AP 6.160 ( Antip. Sid.), 247 ( Phil.), Dsc. 5.75, Arr. Ind. 7.3, Hsch., Eust. 1336.18, 1414.26.

children.label: II
children.definition: ball of anything, τῶν πράσων Eub. 42.3.
globular cake, Ath. 3.114f, 4.140a, Hsch.
gourd, pumpkin, = κολόκυνθα ἀγρία, LXX 4 Ki. 4.39, Phot., Suid.

definition: τομαῖος, α, ον, also ος, ον E. Alc. 101 (lyr.): ( τομή):—

children.definition: cut, cut off, βόστρυχος, χαίτα (cf. τομή I), A. Ch. 168, E. l.c.

children.label: II
children.definition: cut in pieces, ἄκος τ. cut or shredded ready for use, A. Ch. 539, Supp. 268.
Dim. of τόμος II, small volume, tract, Eust. ad D.P. Prooem. p.74 B., EM 790.8, etc.; the τομάρια of Aristonymus are freq. cited by Stob., as 2.31.85,4.46.21.

definition: τομάς, ἡ, v.l. for ἀποτομάς, J. AJ 3.1.2.

children.definition: clearing in a forest, IG 5(2).343 A 6, 12 (Arc., iv B. C.).
need cutting, πρὸς τομῶντι πήματι for a disease that needs the knife, S. Aj. 582.

definition: τομεῖον, τό, = sq. I.3, Hp. ap. Gal. 19.146.
τομεύς, έως, ὁ, Dor. dat. pl. τομέεσσι (vv. ll. τομέσι, τομεσσι) Archim. Spir. 25:—

children.definition: one that cuts, a carver, Poll. 6.13, etc.; τ. σίδηρος Max. 277; πέλεκυς αὐχένος τ. Trag.Adesp. 412; divider, ὁ ἀόρατος τ., i. e. God, Ph. 1.498; as Adj., ὁ τ. λόγος ib. 491.
shoemakerʼs knife, Pl. Alc. 1.129c; edge of a knife, X. Eq.Mag. 2.3.
forceps, gloss on τομεῖον, Gal. 19.146.
τομεῖς, οἱ, cutting-teeth, incisors, Anon.Lond. 24.23, Cels. 8.1, Gal. 2.754, Poll. 2.91, Gp. 16.1.13, Simp. in Cael. 664.3.

children.label: II
children.definition: sector of a circle, Euc. 6.33, Hero *Deff. 34.

τ. στερεός sector of a sphere (intercepted by cone with vertex at centre), Archim. Sph. Sph.Cyl. 1 Def. 5; but τ. ἐν τῇ ἐπιφανείᾳ, i.e. surface included betw. two great circles and a circle cutting each at right angles, Papp. 268.1.
Hsch.

end left after cutting, stump of a tree, ἐπεὶ δὴ πρῶτα τομὴν ἐν ὄρεσσι λέλοιπεν [τὸ σκῆπτρον] Il. 1.235; ῥιζῶν τομαί the ends of the roots ( left by cutting away the tree), S. Fr. 534.5 (anap.); ὀπὸν . . στάζοντα τομῆς ib. 2; δοκοῦ τ. end of a beam, Th. 2.76; ἡ τοῦ καλάμου τ. Thphr. HP 4.11.7, cf. Theoc. 10.46; λίθοι ἐν τομῇ ἐγγώνιοι stones cut square, Th. 1.93 (sed leg. ἐντομῇ) ; σκέψαι τομῇ προσθεῖσα βόστρυχον having fitted the lock to the place from which it was cut, A. Ch. 229 ( σκέψαιτο μὴ cod. M, distinxit Turnebus); πρὸς τὴν τ. μεταστρέφειν to the cut, Pl. Smp. 190e, cf. Arist. HA 532a4.

children.label: b
children.definition: Ταύροιο τ. prob. = προτομή I, Arat. 322.

section, as a circle is the section of a sphere, a conic section of the cone, Arist. Mete. 375b32, Pr. 912a13, cf. App.Anth. 4.74 ( Synesius); with or without κοινή, the line in which two planes cut each other, Arist. Metaph. 1060b14, Euc. 11.16, Archim. Con.Sph. 11, al., Apollon.Perg. Con. 1.4, etc.; point of intersection of two lines, Archim. Spir. 20, al., Ptol. Alm. 3.3, etc.: abstract use, περὶ διωρισμένης τ. On determinate section, name of lost treatise of Apollon.Perg.; τὰ περὶ τὴν τ. the theorems about the section (sc. in extreme and mean ratio), Procl. in Euc. p.67 F.:—in conic sections, τομαὶ ἀντικείμεναι opposite sections, i.e. branches of hyperbola, Apollon.Perg. Con. 2.15; συζυγεῖς τ. conjugate sections of hyperbolas, ib. 17.

data.ref: Procl. in Euc. p.67 F.:—in conic sections,

children.definition: incision or insection between parts of an insectʼs body (whence their name of ἔντομα), Arist. PA 682b25.
ἡ εἰς ἄπειρον τ. infinite divisibility, Epicur. Ep. 1p.16U.

children.label: II
children.definition: cutting, cleaving, ἐν τομᾷ σιδάρου by stroke of iron, S. Tr. 887 (lyr.); πελέκεως τ. E. El. 160 (lyr.); φασγάνου τομαί Id. Or. 1101; cutting off or down, ξύλου S. Tr. 700; vine- cutting, PCair.Zen. 736.29 (iii B.C.); cutting up, εἰς τ. καὶ προσαγωγὴν χάλικος PPetr. 3p.290 (iii B.C.); hewing, λίθων IG 1(2).336.7, 11, SIG 244 ii 58 ( Delph., iv B.C.), IG 42(1).106i19, al. ( Epid., iv B.C.).

use of the knife in surgery, Hp. VC 13; ἢ καύσει ἢ τομῇ χρησάμενος Pl. R. 406d; οὔτε τ. οὔτε καῦσις Hp. Art. 62; σιδήρου τ. Sor. 1.80: pl., Pi. P. 3.53, E. Fr. 403.6; τὰς θεραπείας . . διὰ καύσεών τε καὶ τομῶν Pl. Prt. 354a, cf. Ti. 65b.

data.quote: τὰς θεραπείας . . διὰ καύσεών τε καὶ τομῶν

children.definition: castration, Luc. Philops. 2.
τ. φαρμάκων shredding of drugs, Conon 23.2.
pruning, ἀμπέλων Thphr. CP 3.14.2, Paus. 2.38.3.
σκυτῶν τ. cutting or shaping of leather, Pl. Chrm. 173d.
αἱ τ. τῆς γῆς, i.e. canals, Lib. Or. 18.232.

children.label: III
children.definition: severance, separation, τ. καὶ διάκρισις Pl. Ti. 61d, cf. 80e; of number, division, Id. Lg. 738a; τομὴν ἔχειν ἔν τινι to admit a distinction in . . , ib. 944b; χρονικαὶ τ. distinctions of tenses, A.D. Synt. 10.18; process of division (sc. μεγέθους), Nicom. Ar. 1.2.
logical division, Pl. Plt. 261a, Arist. APo. 95b30, Metaph. 1038a28, Gal. 10.899.
conciseness or precision in expression, Eun. VS p.461B.
τ. πράγματος, = decisio, Gloss.

children.label: IV
children.definition: a cut, wound, Arist. HA 632a18, Aen.Tact. 11.14: metaph., wound, πόλις δεδεγμένη τ. Plu. Cor. 16, cf. Per. 11.
caesura in verse, Aristid.Quint. 1.24; more generally, break between successive words, Hermog. Id. 2.10, Heph. 15.2, al., Eust. 740.1.

children.label: V
children.definition: edge, cutting power, σιδήρου Arr. Tact. 12.2.
one who has been castrated, ὗς οὐ τ. Antiph. 133.5 (anap.); οἱ τ. τῶν βοῶν, ὑῶν, Arist. HA 575b1, 578a33: abs., τομίας (in a list of eatables) PSI 6.553.2 (iii B.C.); of men, eunuch, Hdn. 1.11.2.

children.label: II
children.definition: ὅσοι τομίαι τῶν ὀδόντων Ph. 2.238.

victim cut up for sacrifice, over which oaths were taken, τόμιον ἐντέμνεσθαι to cut such a victim in pieces, Ar. Lys. 192; τὰ τ. the parts of the victim used at this solemnity, ib. 186, Antipho 5.88, Pl. Lg. 753d, Arist. Ath. 55.5; στὰς ἐπὶ τῶν τ. κάπρου καὶ κριοῦ καὶ ταύρου D. 23.68, cf. Aeschin. 2.87, Paus. 5.24.9, al.

data.quote: στὰς ἐπὶ τῶν τ. κάπρου καὶ κριοῦ καὶ ταύρου

children.definition: small log or block of wood, IG 11(2).199 A 55, 219 A 14 ( Delos, iii B.C.).
PFrankf. 5.7, 17 (iii B.C.); τομίου προβάτου Gloss.
sector-like, Sch. Euc. vol. v p.260 H.
cutting, sharp, Pl. Ti. 61e, Timo 4 ( Comp.); v.l. for τολμηρόν in D. 25.24; ὁ μὲν σφαγεὺς ἕστηκεν ᾗ τομώτατος as it will cut sharpest, S. Aj. 815.

λόγος -ώτερος σιδήρου Ps. Phoc. 124. cf. Ep.Hebr. 4.12; of persons, οἱ -ώτατοι the sharpest, hottest, Call. Fr. 78 codd.; ἐρέω τιτομώτερον ἣ ἀπὸ δάφνης Id. Del. 94 codd.; πράξεις -ώτεραι Luc. Tox. 11; cf. τορός. Adv. -μῶς sharply, clearly, Hsch. s.v. τμήδην.

slice, τ. ἐκ πτέρνης Batr. 37; γαστρός, πλακοῦντος, Ar. Eq. 1179, 1190; τῆς χορδῆς Cratin. 192; ἀλλάντων, πυοῦ, Pherecr. 108.8, 19; γογγυλίδος Alex. 88; τυροῦ, ἡνύστρου, Eub. 150.2, Mnesim. 4.14 (anap.): generally, piece, κιθῶνος Michel 832.20 ( Samos, iv B.C.); of wood, beam, IG 11(2).161 D 123, 165.49 ( Delos, iii B.C.).
piece of land, ib. 7.3170.12 ( Orchom. Boeot.), cf. 1739, 1742 ( Thespiae).

τ. κυλίνδρου frustum of a cylinder, portion of right cylinder intercepted betw. two parallel oblique sections, Archim. Con.Sph.Def.; τ. ἀπὸ ὀρθογωνίου κώνου τομᾶς ἀφαιρούμενος frustum of the section of a right-angled cone, i e. portion of a parabola cut off by two parallel double-ordinates, Id. Aequil. 2.10.

children.label: II
children.definition: roll of papyrus, PCair.Zen. 357.15 (iii B.C.), LXX Is. 8.1, PSI 10.1146.1 (ii A.D.), Sammelb. 7362.1 (ii A.D.), etc.; τ. συγκολλήσιμος PGrenf. 2.41.18 (i A.D.); τιμῆς ἀπὸ τόμου ἀγραφίου PMich.Teb. 123vvii 25 (i A.D.); tome, volume, PMich. in Class.Phil. 22.10 (ii A.D.), D.L. 6.15: metaph., ἐν καθαρῷ διανοίας τ. Porph. Marc. 32.

priests of Zeus at Dodona, εἰ μέν κʼ αἰνήσωσι Διὸς μεγάλοιο Τομοῦροι, an ancient reading for θέμιστες in Od. 16.403, v. Str. 7.7.11, who explains it as a shortd. form of Τομάρ-ουροι, guardians of Mount Tomarus, cf. Hsch. s.v. Τόμαρος; the variant is given as Τόμουραι by Eust. 1760.47, 1806.37; τόμουρε = μάντι occurs in Lyc. 223, cf. Hsch.

data.ref: Str. 7.7.11, who explains it as a shortd. form of

children.definition: stretched, δρόμος Suid., Zonar.

children.label: II
children.definition: τοναία (sc. φωνή), ἡ, strained, loud voice, Alex. 169.

children.label: III
children.definition: Τόναια, τά, v. Τόνεα.
pitch-pipe, to give the key-note for singing or speaking, Quint. Inst. 1.10.27; cf. ἐπιτόνιον.

definition: τόνεα, τά, festival of Hera at Samos, Menodot. 1 (better Τόναια, as Kaibel).

children.definition: Eust. 60.14 ( Pass.).
prolongation of a note at the same pitch, Cleonid. Harm. 14.

speak inarticulately, mumble, Ar. Ach. 683 (troch.), Ra. 747, V. 614 (anap.), Luc. Deor.Conc. 1, Aristaenet. 2.6; gurgle, ἐτονθόρυζε ταῦρος <ὡς> νεοσφαγής A. Fr. 298:—in all these passages the best codd. have the form in -ύζω; τονθορύξει (prob. 2 sg. fut.) occurs in Herod. 7.77; both forms are cited by Hsch.; -ίζω is found in codd. of Gal. 2.689, Thom.Mag. p.352R., etc., but is never expressly mentioned by Gramm.; cf. ὑποτονθορύζω.— Rarer collat. forms, τονθολῠγέω, gurgle, Pherecr. 108.4; distd. from τανθαρύζω (q.v.) by Ptol.Asc. p.410H., Ammon. Diff. p.79V.; τονθρ-ύζω, Herod. 8.8, Opp. C. 2.541, 3.169 (recognized as Att. along with τονθορύζω by Phryn. 336, cf. PS p.115 B.); cf. τον-ύς, ἡ, muttering, Hsch.; τονθρ-υστής, οῦ, ὁ, mutterer, = γογγυστής, Aq. Pr. 16.28; τονθρ-υσμός and τονθορυσμός, ὁ, Phryn. 336. (Prob. onomatop.)

data.ref: Herod. 7.77; both forms are cited by

definition: τόνθων παρὰ Κορίννῃ ( Fr. 40), ἐπὶ νωτιαίου (cod. νοτιβίου) κρέως τὸ ὄνομα, Hsch.

children.definition: consisting of one tone, in Music, διάστημα Arist. Pr. 922b6, cf. Plu. An.procr. 2.1018f, Aristox. (?) Oxy. 667.20, Alex.Aphr. in Top. 113.12.
τὸ τ. χρῶμα, = τὸ τονικὸν χ., Cleonid. Harm. 7.
furnish with an accent, Troil. Proll.Hermog. [45] ap. Rh. 6.45 W., Cod.Vat. 1751 in AB 1169 (note), Gloss.
of or for stretching, capable of extension, ὄρνιθες κατὰ πτέρυγας τονικοί Arist. PA 693b12.
τὸ τονικὸν [χρῶμα] (opp. τὸ ἡμιτόνιον (fort. ἡμιόλιον, cf. Cleonid. Harm. 7) and τὸ μαλακόν), one of the three forms of χρῶμα or chromatic scale, S.E. M. 6.51.
of or for accents, τονικὰ παραγγέλματα A.D. Adv. 181.9 (so περὶ τ. π., treatise by Jo.Alex.); τὸ -κόν A.D. Pron. 35.13.
resulting from τόνος II.4, κίνησις, of God, opp. μεταβατικῶς κινούμενος, Stoic. 2.149, cf. 147, al.
contractile, ἐνέργεια, of a muscle, Gal. 4.436; [ πέπερι] στομάχου -ώτερον Id. 6.265. Adv. -κῶς Id. 4.435.

definition: τόνιος, α, ον, = foreg.: τόνια, τά,

children.definition: ‘tractor’ machines, Heliod. ap. Orib. 49.2.1, al.; τονία, ἡ, rope of a pulley, Poll. 10.31.
one must accentuate, Sch. Pi. P. 4.9.
drawn with difficulty, v.l. (ap. Erot.) for γονοειδές in Hp. Epid. 2.3.11.

that by which a thing is stretched, or that which can itself be stretched, cord, brace, band, οἱ τ. τῶν κλινέων the cords of beds or chairs, Hdt. 9.118, cf. Ar. Eq. 532 (anap.), Philippid. 12, Michel 832.48 ( Samos, iv B.C.); sg., bedcords, Ar. Lys. 923; ὠμολίνου μακροὶ τόνοι A. Fr. 206; ἐκ τριῶν τ. of three plies or strands, of ropes, X. Cyn. 10.2.
τόνοι are sinews or tendons, Hp. Art. 11 ( = nerves acc. to Gal. 18(1).380):—of pneumogastric nerves, Ruf. Onom. 158.
twisted skeins of gut in torsion-engines, Ph. Bel. 65.34, al., Hero Bel. 83.4, Plu. Marc. 15.

children.label: b
children.definition: γαστραφέτης, = αἱ ἐκ τῶν ἄκρων κάμψεις, Hero Bel. 75.7.

children.label: c
children.definition: ὑποζωμάτων τέτταρας τόνους ἐγ νεωρίων IG 2(2).1673.12; τ. αἰχμάλωτοι ib. 1610.23; τ. αἰχμάλωτος ἀδόκιμος ib. 1613.282.
row or line of pillars, ib. 1668.48.

children.label: II
children.definition: stretching, tightening, straining, strain, tension, ὁ τ. τῶν ὅπλων Hdt. 7.36; power of contracting muscles, Sor. 1.112; τ. καὶ ῥώμη Id. 2.48; τὸν τῆς ὁλκῆς τ. ὑπεκλῦσαι diminish the strength of the pull, ib. 61.
raising of the voice, Aeschin. 3.209,210, D. 18.280, Phld. Lib. p.19 O., etc.: hence,

data.ref: Phld. Lib. p.19 O., etc.: hence,

children.label: a
children.definition: pitch of the voice, Pl. R. 617b, Arist. Phgn. 807a17, etc.; including volume, τόνοι φωνῆς· ὀξύ, βαρύ, μικρόν, μέγα X. Cyn. 6.20; κλαυθμυρίσαι μετὰ τόνου τοῦ προσήκοντος, of a new-born baby, Sor. 1.79; τῷ αὐτῷ τ. εἰπεῖν Arist. Rh. 1413b31; ἐν τ. ἀνιεμένοις καὶ βαρέσι Id. Aud. 804a26; τὴν φωνὴν καὶ τὸν τ. ἐξάραντα Hieronym. ap. D.H. Isoc. 13 (cf. Phld. Rh. 1.198 S.); σῴζειν τὸν τ. Longin. 9.13: pl., Phld. Rh. 1.196S.; of a musical instrument, Plu. Monarch. 2.827b, etc.; diatonic scale, APl. 16.220 (Antip.): metaph. of colour, ‘values’, Plin. HN 35.29.

data.quote: τόνοι φωνῆς· ὀξύ, βαρύ, μικρόν, μέγα

children.label: b
children.definition: pitch or accent of a word or syllable, Arist. Rh. 1403b29, D.T. 629.27, A.D. Pron. 8.8, al., Gal. 16.495 (the meaning of the Adv. τόνῳ mentioned by A.D. Adv. 167.2 is not given by him ( = λίαν, Hsch.); τόνῳ, = μετὰ προθυμίας ἰσχυρᾶς, was read by Gal. (16.585) in Hp. Prorrh. 1.36 ( ξὺν τόνῳ or ξὺν πόνῳ codd. Hp.)).

data.ref: A.D. Adv. 167.2 is not given by him ( = λίαν,

children.label: c
children.definition: measure or metre, ἐν ἑξαμέτρῳ τ. Hdt. 1.47, 62, 5.60; ἐν τριμέτρῳ τ. Id. 1.174.

children.label: d
children.definition: key, Aristox. Harm. 2p.37M., Plu. Mus. 2.1134a, 1135a, etc.

mental or physical exertion, τ. ἀμφʼ ἀρετῆς, i.e. in praising it, Xenoph. 1.20; bodily energy, ἰσχὺς καὶ τ. Luc. Anach. 25, cf. 27; συστρέψαι τὸν τ. (by massage) Gal. 6.91: generally, force, intensity, Plu. Demetr. 21, 2.563f, etc.; τ. ὀργῆς Id. Brut. 34; τ. πνεύματος Luc. Dem.Enc. 7; ὁ τ. τῆς φαρμακείης its efficiency, Hp. Ep. 16; τ. δυνάμεων, title of a work by Heras, Gal. 13.416; τ. σοφιστικός Eun. VS p.497B.

‘tension’, force, in Nature and Man, πληγὴ πυρὸς ὁ τόνος ἐστί, κἂν ἱκανὸς ἐν τῇ ψυχῇ γένηται πρὸς τὸ ἐπιτελεῖν τὰ ἐπιβάλλοντα, ἰσχὺς καλεῖται καὶ κράτος Cleanth.Stoic. 1.128; ὁ ζωτικὸς τ. Stoic. 2.235, Gal. 6.321; αἰσθητικὸς τ. Stoic. 2.215; συνεκτικὸς τ. the tension which holds the universe together, ib. 134.

data.quote: πληγὴ πυρὸς ὁ τόνος ἐστί, κἂν ἱκανὸς ἐν τῇ ψυχῇ γένηται πρὸς τὸ ἐπιτελεῖν τὰ ἐπιβάλλοντα, ἰσχὺς καλεῖται καὶ κράτος

children.label: III
children.definition: tenor of oneʼs way, course, εὐθὺν τ. τρέχειν Pi. O. 10(11).64; ἕνα τόνον ἔχειν Plu. Dem. 13.

children.label: IV
children.definition: quarter of a city, IG 12(5).872.36, al. ( Tenos).

brace up, τὰ σώματα καὶ τὰς ψυχάς Ti.Locr. 103d, cf. Plu. QConv. 2.647c, Agathin. ap. Orib. 10.7.7, Sor. 1.47, al., Gal. 6.411; Ῥωμαίους ἐτόνωσεν αἰδὼς δόξης J. BJ 5.11.6:— Pass., ἡ δεξιὰ τετόνωται ib. 1.26.2; [ οὐσίαι] ἐπὶ τὸ οἰκεῖον τῇ φύσει αὐτῶν παραγίνονται σχῆμα τετονωμέναι Stoic. 2.149 (cf. τόνος II 4); τοῦ ἀναπνεομένου ἀέρος . . ὑφ οὗ τονοῦται τὸ τῆς ψυχῆς εἶδος Nicom. ap. Theol.Ar. 48.

data.quote: οὐσίαι] ἐπὶ τὸ οἰκεῖον τῇ φύσει αὐτῶν παραγίνονται σχῆμα τετονωμέναι
τοῦ ἀναπνεομένου ἀέρος . . ὑφ οὗ τονοῦται τὸ τῆς ψυχῆς εἶδος

children.label: II
children.definition: place the accent on a word or syllable, accentuate it, Sch. Il. 12.137; περὶ τῶν διαφόρως τονουμένων, title of work by Phlp. (ed. Egenolff, Vratisl. 1880).
Hp. Coac. 635, Gal. 6.237, Archig. ap. eund. 8.109, Paul.Aeg. 1.20.
strengthening, bracing, Aret. CD 1.3; τοῦ βρέφους Sor. 1.95; τοῦ πνεύματος ib. 108; activity, force, Ruf. ap. Orib. 8.24.19: abs., ‘tone’, Apollon. ap. Orib. 7.19.1.
vehemence in rhetoric, τονώσεις καὶ περιπαθήσεις Ph. 1.158.

children.label: II
children.definition: accentuation, Eust. 341.21.
one must brace up, Herod.Med. in Hermes 40.591, Orib. Fr. 64.
bracing, strengthening, Sor. 2.48, Gal. 6.577: c. gen., Antyll. ap. Orib. 6.32.10, 6.35.1, Sor. 1.49.

shoot with a bow, Od. 8.220, 228: c. gen. objecti, shoot at, εἰ καὶ . . τοξαζοίατο φωτῶν ib. 218; κακῶς ἀνδρῶν τοξάζεαι 22.27: later c. acc., τ. θῆρας Opp. C. 4.54.—Poet. word, for which τοξεύω is usual in Prose, but τοξάζω ( Act.) occurs in Heraclit. All. 13.
mighty with the bow, Orph. H. 58.2.

definition: τοξάριον [ᾰ], τό, Dim. of τόξον, Luc. DMort. 12[14].2, Longus 1.7, al.

children.definition: to be captain of the archers, Supp.Epigr. 2.361 (Apollonia in Illyricum, iv/iii B. C.), IG 4.698 ( Hermione, ii A.D.).
lord of the bow, archer, of the Persians (cf. τόξον 1.1), A. Pers. 556 (lyr.).

children.label: II
children.definition: captain of the archers, IG 1(2).79.7, Th. 3.98; also τοξάρχης, Arr. An. 1.8.4, 1.22.7.

children.label: II
children.definition: οἱ τοξόται, force of archers, Philostr. VA 8.7: pl., bows, J. AJ 5.5.4.
drawing the bow, Man. 4.244.

arrow, Hdt. 4.132, al., S. Fr. 427, E. Fr. 455, Dsc. 3.32; τρωθεὶς εἰς τὸμ πλεύμονα τοξεύματι IG 42(1).122.56 ( Epid., iv B. C.); ὅσον τ. ἐξικνέεται the distance of a bow-shot, Hdt. 4.139; πρὶν τ. ἐξικνεῖσθαι before an arrow reached them, X. An. 1.8.19; ἐπειδὴ εἰς τ. ἀφίκοιντο came within shot, Id. Cyr. 1.4.23; ἐντὸς τοξεύματος ibid., E. HF 991; ἔξω τοξεύματος Th. 7.30; ἔβαλλον Βακχίου τοξεύμασι κάρα γέροντος, of the cottabus, E. Fr. 562; φαρέτρα τοξευμάτων a quiverful of arrows (as a prize), IG 12(5).647.28 ( Ceos, iii B. C.); missile of any kind, Ascl. Tact. 1.2: metaph., of songs and words, Pi. I. 5(4).47; so καρδίας τοξεύματα S. Ant. 1085; ὄμματος θελκτήριον τόξευμα A. Supp. 1005.

data.ref: Ascl. Tact. 1.2: metaph., of songs and words,

children.label: II
children.definition: οἱ τοξόται, force of archers, Hdt. 6.112, Plu. Pyrrh. 21.
bowman: only as pr.n. Bowman, Hes. Fr. 110.4.
a shooting with the bow, metaph., ὀμμάτων Lib. Descr. 30.8, 9.

definition: τοξευτήρ, ῆρος, ὁ, = sq. ΙΙ, Arat. 506, 685; the Centaur, ib. 400: = sq. Ι, c. gen., βελέμνων Orph. L. 499: fem. τοξεύτειρα, Opp. C. 3.22.

children.label: II
children.definition: a species of wolf, Ar.Byz. Epit. 89.11, Opp. C. 3.296.
bowman, archer, Il. 23.850, Call. Fr. 130, D.P. 751.

children.label: II
children.definition: Sagittarius, Arat. 306, al.
of archery, ἡ τ. (sc. τέχνη) Gal. Thras. 45, cf. Eust. 40.22.
struck by an arrow, ἐκ Φοίβου S. Ph. 335.

shoot with the bow, τινος at a mark, Il. 23.855; πάντες, ὥστε τοξόται σκοποῦ, τοξεύετʼ ἀνδρὸς τοῦδε S. Ant. 1034; also τ. ἐπὶ σκοποῦ Pl. Sis. 391a; ἐς ἀλλήλους Hdt. 1.214, cf. X. Cyr. 3.3.66; κατά τινων Luc. Pisc. 7 (metaph.); ἐς χωρίον, ἐς τὰ γυμνά, Hdt. 8.128, Th. 3.23; ἐπʼ ἐκεῖνο Luc. Cal. 15 (metaph.); πρὸς τὸν οὐρανόν Hdt. 4.94: metaph., τοξεύσασα τῆς εὐδοξίας E. Tr. 643, cf. Ion 1411: abs., use the bow, Hdt. 1.136; τὸν παῖδα τοξεύσας ἀπολωλέκεε by an arrow, Id. 3.74, cf. Ar. Av. 1187, Th. 4.48, etc.; καθʼ ὑπερβολὰν τοξεύσας having shot too high, S. OT 1197 (lyr.); εὔστοχα or ἄσκοπα τ. with good or no aim, Luc. Nigr. 36, Tox. 62.

data.quote: πάντες, ὥστε τοξόται σκοποῦ, τοξεύετʼ ἀνδρὸς τοῦδε

children.label: II
children.definition: shoot or hit with an arrow, X. An. 4.2.12; θηρίον Id. Cyr. 1.2.10; ἔλαφον Arist. Mir. 837a15:— Pass., to be struck by an arrow, Th. 3.98, X. An. 1.8.20, 4.1.18, Dsc. 3.32.
Ἔρως ἐτόξευσʼ αὐτόν E. Tr. 255; ἡ τυραννὶς πάντοθεν τοξεύεται is aimed at, Id. Fr. 850.

shoot from a bow, metaph., discharge, send forth, τ. ὕμνους Pi. I. 2.3; γλῶσσα τοξεύσασα μὴ τὰ καίρια A. Supp. 446; ταῦτα νοῦς ἐτόξευσεν μάτην hath shot these arrows in vain, E. Hec. 603:— Pass., ἡμῖν γὰρ ἤδη πᾶν τετόξευται βέλος A. Eu. 676.

data.quote: ἡμῖν γὰρ ἤδη πᾶν τετόξευται βέλος

children.definition: furnished with the bow, χείρ E. Alc. 35 (anap.), cf. Rh. 226 (lyr.).
Id. HF 188; τ. ψαλμός the twang of the bowstring, ib. 1063 (lyr.).
Leg.Gort. 3.9.
persons born under Sagittarius, Cat.Cod.Astr. 7.112 ( Τοξινιανοί cod.).

definition: τοξίας, ου, ὁ, epith. of Apollo at Sicyon, Hsch., cf. Theognost. Can. 42.

children.definition: of or for the bow, τ. θῶμιγξ, ἄτρακτος, A. Pers. 460, Fr. 139; τ. στολή an archerʼs equipment, Pl. Lg. 833b; τ. κάλαμος a kind of Cretan reed used for arrows, Thphr. HP 4.11.11.
ἡ τοξική (sc. τέχνη) archery, Pl. Smp. 197a, La. 193b, al., SIG 1060.5 ( Tralles, iv/iii B.C.).
τὸ -κόν shot-hole, loophole, LXX Jd. 5.28, Sm. Ez. 40.16: so -κή (sc. θυρίς) Ph. Bel. 81.25.

children.label: II
children.definition: skilled in the use of the bow, [ Πάνδαρος] Plu. Pyth. 2.405b; τοξικώτατοι X. Cyr. 6.2.4.

children.label: III
children.definition: τὸ -κόν, collectively, the bowmen, for οἱ τοξόται, Ar. Lys. 462, D.C. 36.47; πηλίκα τοξικὰ ἔχουσι; Mim.Oxy. 413.198.
τ. φάρμακον poison for smearing arrows with, Arist. Mir. 837a13, BGU 21 ii 14 (iv A. D.), Orib. Fr. 126: τὸ τ. Str. 3.4.18, Dsc. 1.106, Ael. NA 9.15: pl., Dsc. 2.79.

children.label: b
children.definition: = venenum, Gloss.

definition: τοξῖτις, ιδος, ἡ, with or without νευρά,

children.definition: the bowstring in torsion-engines, Hero Bel. 110.9, cf. 75.14, Ph. Bel. 65.51.

children.label: II
children.definition: Nuova Silloge 452.

definition: τοξοβέλεμνος, ον, = sq., of Apollo, Orph. H. 34.6.

children.definition: shooting with the bow, AP 9.179 ( Leon.), 12.181 ( Strat.).

definition: τοξοδάμας [δᾰ], αντος, ὁ, = sq., A. Pers. 26, 30, 926 (all anap.).

children.definition: subduing with the bow, τ. Ἄρης the war of archers, i.e. the Persians (cf. τόξον I.1), A. Pers. 86 (lyr.); Ἄρτεμις E. Hipp. 1451, cf. Diph. 30, Lyc. 1331.
bow-shaped, Callix. 1.
bow-case, quiver, Sch. Ar. Th. 1209.
famed for archery, Pi. Fr. 312, B. 10.39.

bow, Il. 4.124, etc.: freq. in pl. τόξα for sg., τόξʼ ὤμοισιν ἔχων ἀμφηρεφέα τε φαρέτρην 1.45, al., cf. Pi. P. 3.101, S. Ph. 654; sts. in Prose, Heraclit. 51, Hdt. 2.106, PEleph. 5.8 (iii B. C.); ἐτιταίνετο . . τόξα drew the bow, Il. 5.97; also τόξον τιταίνει B. 9.43; τόξον ἕλκετʼ (v.l. εἷλκεν) Il. 11.582; τόξου πῆχυν ἀνέλκειν 13.583; τόξον τείνειν, ἐντείνειν, A. Ag. 364 (anap.), Fr. 83; τ . . . ἐντανύσαι Od. 21.245, cf. Hdt. 2.173; κυκλοτερὲς μέγα τ. ἔτεινε Il. 4.124, cf. E. Ba. 1066; τόξου ῥῦμα (i.e. the Persians, the bow being an oriental weapon), opp. λόγχης ἰσχύς (i.e. the Greeks), A. Pers. 147 (anap.).

data.quote: τόξʼ ὤμοισιν ἔχων ἀμφηρεφέα τε φαρέτρην

children.definition: τόξῳ by guess, Id. Ch. 1033.
bowmanship, archery, τόξων ἐῢ εἰδώς Il. 2.718, al.; τόξοισιν πίσυνος 5.205, cf. 13.716; ἡ τέχνη τῶν τ. Hdt. 1.73; πρὸς τόξου κρίσιν S. Tr. 266; τόξῳ (sc. νικῶν) SIG 1061.10 ( Samos, ii B. C.).

children.label: II
children.definition: bow and arrows, τόξα πεπτεῶτʼ ἄλλυδις ἄλλα Il. 21.502, cf. Hdt. 3.78, S. Ph. 68, al.; sts. in pl. for the arrows only, ib. 652, Pl. Lg. 815a.

children.label: III

children.label: IV
children.definition: rainbow, Aeschrio 4, LXX Ge. 9.13, Hsch. s.v. εἴρη.
arch, AP 9.694.
curved support, cradle used in amputations, Archig. ap. Orib. 47.13.6; part of a carriage or cart, PPetr. 2p.133, 3p.144 (iii B. C.).

children.definition: become arched, ἐς τὸ πρηνές Aret. SA 1.5; ἐς τὸ πρόσθεν ib. 6.
make like a bow, arch, τ. τὰς ὀφρῦς, of a supercilious person, Ar. Lys. 8, Alciphr. 3.19; τὴν ὀφρὺν εἴς τινα Longus 4.20.
the making of bows, Poll. 7.156.
bow-maker, bowyer, Poll. 7.156, Gloss.
bowmanship, archery, Il. 13.314, E. Andr. 1194 (lyr.).—Poet. word, ἡ τοξική being used in Prose.
armed with the bow, A. Supp. 288.

bowman, archer, Il. 11.385, A. Ag. 628, IG 1(2).929.67, 949.79, Hdt. 3.39, Th. 4.28, etc.; τοὺς τ. τούς τε ἀστοὺς καὶ τοὺς ξένους IG 1(2).79.3; ἀτράκτων τοξόται E. Rh. 312; τ. στρατός Pi. O. 13.89; as a device on Persian coins, Plu. Ages. 15, Art. 20.

data.quote: τοὺς τ. τούς τε ἀστοὺς καὶ τοὺς ξένους

children.definition: the Archer, Sagittarius, a sign in the Zodiac, Eudox. ap. Hipparch. 1.2.20, Luc. VH 1.18, Ptol. Alm. 8.1, Vett.Val. 11.3, Supp.Epigr. 7.363.3 (Dura-Europus, ii A. D.).

children.label: II
children.definition: οἱ τοξόται were the city-police, Ar. Ach. 54, 711 (troch.), Eq. 665, And. 3.5, Pl. Prt. 319c, Arist. Ath. 24.3; cf. Σκύθης II.1.

children.label: b
children.definition: archer-cavalry, Ascl. Tact. 1.3; cf. Σκύθης II 2.

definition: τοξότις, ιδος, ἡ, fem. of foreg.,

children.definition: archeress, of Atalanta, Call. Dian. 223; of Artemis, Orph. H. 36.2, etc.: as Adj., τ. χείρ AP 6.188 ( Leon.):— Τοξότιδες, name of a play by A.

children.label: II
children.definition: loophole for shooting arrows, Plb. 8.7.3; cf. τοξικός, I.3.

children.label: III
children.definition: Poet. de herb. 26, Apul. Herb. 10; also called τοξιτησία, Ps.- Dsc. 3.113.
drawing the bow, τοξουλκῷ λήματι πιστούς trusting to skill in archery, of the Persians (cf. τόξον 1.1), A. Pers. 55 (anap.).

children.label: II
children.definition: τ. αἰχμή the bow-stretching arrow, ib. 239 (troch.).
bear a bow, of Eros, AP 12.162 ( Asclep.).

definition: τοξοφόρμιγξ, f.l. in Demetr. Eloc. 85 ( τόξῳ φόρμιγγα Nauck).

children.definition: bow-bearing, epith. of Artemis, Il. 21.483, Simon. 107.4 (= IG 7.53), Ar. Th. 970 (lyr.); of Apollo, h.Ap. 13, 126, Pi. Pae.Fr. 19.30; of Heracles, E. Tr. 804 (lyr.); of the Cretans, Pi. P. 5.41; of the Medes and Persians, Simon. 137.3, Orac. ap. Hdt. 9.43, cf. Epigr. ap. Arist. Fr. 674; of the Phrygians, E. Rh. 32 (lyr.): Subst., οἱ τ., = τοξόται, Hdt. 1.103.

data.ref: Pi. P. 5.41; of the Medes and Persians,

arcuatus, Gloss.
governor, Sammelb. 5231.2 (i A. D.), 5275.1 (i A. D.). (Egyptian word.)

definition: τόπαζος, ὁ, a gem of green hue ( Plin. HN 37.107), hence prob.

children.definition: chrysolite or peridot, AP 6.329 ( Leon.Alex.), J. AJ 3.7.5, D.P. 1121, Orph. L. 278:—also τόπαζον, τό, Eust. ad D.P. l.c.; τοπάζιον, LXX Ex. 28.17, Ps. 118(119).127, Str. 16.4.6, D.S. 3.39, Apoc. 21.20:—Pliny ( HN l.c.) gives the name of topazon ( v.l. topazium) to two varieties. (From the Trogodyte language acc. to Plin. l.c.; perh. the same as ταβάσιος.)

aim at, guess, divine, τὸ γὰρ τοπάζειν τοῦ σαφʼ εἰδέναι δίχα A. Ag. 1369; ἃ δὲ δόξῃ τοπάζω, ταῦτʼ ἰδεῖν σαφῶς θέλω S. Fr. 235; τοπάζετε Ar. V. 73; τ. περί τινος Pl. Tht. 155d: folld. by a relat. clause, ib. 151b; εἴτε . . , εἴτε μὴ . . Id. Chrm. 159a: folld. by acc. et inf., Id. Grg. 489d, Phdr. 228d:— Pass., νέον τι γίνεσθαι ἐτοπάσθη D.C. 78.25. (The literal sense to put in a place, given by Hsch., is not found in classical Gr.)

data.quote: τὸ γὰρ τοπάζειν τοῦ σαφʼ εἰδέναι δίχα
ἃ δὲ δόξῃ τοπάζω, ταῦτʼ ἰδεῖν σαφῶς θέλω

data.ref: Id. Chrm. 159a: folld. by acc. et

children.definition: pagus, Gloss.
to be a τοπάρχης, PSI 6.617.20 (iii B. C.), PCair.Zen. 322.3 (iii B.C.), Tz. H. 10.426, etc.

governor of a district, esp. in Egypt, LXX Ge. 41.34, PRev.Laws 37.3, 41.7, al. (iii B. C.), PTeb. 48.6 (ii B. C.); elsewh., LXX Da. 3.94(27), D.S. 6.1.10, J. AJ 8.7.2, IGRom. 3.901 ( Cilicia, i B.C.), Procop. Pers. 2.12, Cat.Cod.Astr. 5(3).89: cf. τοπογραμματεύς.
district governed by a τοπάρχης, PSI 4.412 (iii B. C.), PRev.Laws 87.4 (iii B. C.), PTeb. 24.62 (ii B. C.), LXX 1 Ma. 11.28, OG 1669.49 ( Egypt, i A. D.), J. AJ 13.4.9, al., POxy. 2118.3 (ii A. D.).
ruling over a place, γυνή mistress, A. Ch. 664 ( ταπαρχος (suprascr. ό) cod. M).

children.label: II
children.definition: SIG 880.29, al. ( Pizus, iii A. D.).
one must conjecture, Hsch.
divinatory, sagacious, Men. Epit. 340.
rope, cord, Archipp. 33, Stratt. 30, Is. Fr. 24, IG 2(2).1609.64,101, 1611.299, SIG 241 A 29 ( Delph., iv B. C.); cf. τοπήϊον.
Eust. 543.17; cf. ὑποτοπέω.
discussion on a τόπος or common-place, rhetorical treatment of the same, Longin. 11.2: pl., Id. 12.5, 32.5.

definition: τοπήϊον, τό, Ion. for τοπεῖον, Call. Del. 315.

children.definition: localize, in Pass., Simp. in Ph. 631.8, al.
of or for place, in respect to place, ὕλη τ., = κατὰ τόπον κινητή, Arist. Metaph. 1042b6. Adv. -κῶς Peripl.M.Rubr. 5, al., Plu. Def.orac. 2.424e.

local, φυλαί D.H. 4.14; ἄνεμοι Antyll. ap. Orib. 9.9.1; τ. δυναστεία local influence, PRyl. 114.16 (iii A. D.); τ. βία PFlor. 58.8 (iii A. D.); of local make, ἀγγεῖον TAM 2.437 ( Patara). Adv. -κῶς in the local dialect, opp. συνήθως, Sch. Th. Oxy. 853 xiii 3.
to be applied locally, topical, Sor. 2.15, Gal. 12.383; τ. συγκίνησις Sor. 1.46 ( τροπ- cod.); τ. ἕλκος, πόνος, Id. 2.36, Fract. 15; τ. διάθεσις Gal. 16.710. Adv. -κῶς Ruf. Anat. 30, Sor. 1.102.
τ. ἐπίρρημα adverb of place, D.T. 641.32, A.D. Conj. 243.29.

children.label: II
children.definition: concerning τόποι or common-places, Arist. Rh. 1396b21; he wrote a treatise τὰ τοπικά, being (as he says) the method or theory of drawing conclusions ἐξ ἐνδόξων; τ. ἀντίθεσις Hermog. Stat. 6; -ώτεροι λόγοι Id. Id. 2.11. Adv. -κῶς Id. Stat. 3, 12.

data.ref: Arist. Rh. 1396b21; he wrote a treatise

children.definition: field, PLond. 1.131.199 (i A. D.); ἄγιον τ. holy place, i.e. monastery, ib. 77.25 (vi A. D.); burial-place, tomb, written τόπην MAMA 3.81 ( Diocaesarea), 372 ( Corycus); τόπιν ib. 168 ( Corasium).

children.label: II
children.definition: topia, neut. pl., artistic representation in which natural or artificial features of a place are used as the medium, Vitr. 7.5.2: so, opus topiarium, Plin. HN 16.140, al.
localization, Simp. in Ph. 774.27.
of or belonging to a place, St.Byz. s.v. Ἀγρός, al.
office of τοπογραμματεύς, PTeb. 24.66 (ii B.C.), PSI 1.101.16 (ii A. D.), etc.
secretary of a τόπος (v. τοπάρχης), an Egyptian official, PPetr. 3p.71 (iii B.C.), PTeb. 27.2, al. (ii B. C.), OGI 665.31, 666.14 (both i A.D.), etc.
describe a place or country, Ath. 1.16d.

children.label: II
children.definition: determine the site of a place, Str. 13.1.5.
description of a country, topography, Str. 8.1.3 (pl.); τῶν ἠπείρων ib. 1, cf. Ptol. Geog. 1.1.5.
description of a ‘region’, Petos. ap. Vett.Val. 125.22.
topographer, D.S. 31.18.
topography, τῆς κατʼ Αἴγυπτον χώρας D.S. 1.42, cf. Cic. Att. 1.16.18, Ptol. Geog. 1.1.3.
situation, arrangement of heavenly bodies in regions, Vett.Val. 42.12.

children.label: II
children.definition: description of a place, topographical account, Cic. Att. 1.13.5.
plan, survey, POxy. 100.10 (ii A. D.), etc.
region, quarter, PMasp. 162.9 (vi A. D.).
= canalis, Gloss.
describe, τὴν ὅλην οἰκουμένην Str. 2.5.1, cf. 12.3.23 (Casaub.).
rule or be master of a place, Ph. 2.383.
Paul.Al. O. 1.

wage war by seeking or holding strong positions which the enemy dares not attack, Str. 1.1.17, Plu. Flam. 3, Cleom. 20, etc.; manoeuvre for position, Id. Frat. 2.487f, Demetr. 43; περὶ τῆς στάσεως D.S. 13.39.

definition: τόπος, ὁ (fem. by attraction τόπον τὰν καλειμέναν Δαματρείαν IG 9(1).32.80 ( Stiris, ii B.C.)),

children.definition: place, region, first in A. (v. infr.), afterwds. freq. in all writers; periphr., χθονὸς πᾶς τ., i.e. the whole earth, A. Eu. 249; ἐς τὸν Ἑλλήνων τ. Id. Pers. 790; ἐν Ἑλλάδος τόποις in Greece, ib. 796; ἐν Αὐλίδοστ. Id. Ag. 191 (lyr.); Πέλοπος ἐντ. Id. Eu. 703, cf. 292; πρὸς ἑσπέρους τ. towards the West, Id. Pr. 350; πρόσθε Σαλαμῖνος τόπων before Salamis, Id. Pers. 447; Θρῄκης ἐκ τόπων E. Alc. 67; Διρκαίων ἐκ τ. Id. Ph. 1027 (lyr.): so in Prose, district, ὁ τ. ὁ Ἑλληνικός Isoc. 5.107, cf. Ep. 1.8; ὁ περὶ Θρᾴκην τ. D. 20.59; ὁ ἐπὶ Θρᾴκης τ. Aeschin. 2.9, 3.73; ὁ τ. οὗτος, ἐν τούτοις τοῖς τ., X. An. 4.4.4, Cyr. 2.4.20; ὅλος τ. a whole region, D. 19.230; κατὰ τόπους καὶ κώμας Pl. Criti. 119a; οἱ τῆς χώρας τ. the places of a country, Id. Lg. 760c, etc. (but ὁ τ. τῆς χώρας the geographical position, D. 4.31; region, Pl. Lg. 705c); ὁ ἅγιοστ., of Jerusalem, LXX 2 Ma. 2.18 (cf. infr. 5); the universe divided into three τόποι, Arist. IA 706b3, Cael. 312a8 (contrast PA 666a15, etc.); οἱ κοινοὶ τ. public sites or buildings, IG 42(1).65.8 (Epid.); ἄσυλος τ. BGU 1053 ii 9 (i B. C.), PTeb. 5.83 (pl., ii B. C.); οἰκίαι καὶ τόποι houses and sites, ib. 281.12 (ii B.C.); so ψιλοὶ τ. sites not built upon, OGI 52.2 ( Ptolemais, iii/ii B. C.).

data.ref: LXX 2 Ma. 2.18 (cf. infr. 5); the universe divided into three

children.definition: place, position, οὐ τὸν τρόπον, ἀλλὰ τὸν τ. μόνον μεταλλάξαι Aeschin. 3.78; ὑπολιποῦ τ. leave a space (in a document), PCair.Zen. 327.83 (iii B.C.); περικήπῳ τ. καταλιπεῖν ib. 193.8 (iii B.C.); τ. ἔχειν have a place, D.H. Dem. 23, Plu. QConv. 2.646a; φίλου τ. ἔχειν hold the place of . . , Arr. Epict. 2.4.5; Μερόλας ὁ αἱρεθεὶς ὕπατος εἰς τὸν τοῦ Κίννα τ. D.S. 38/ 39.3; ἐνεγράφη εἰς τὴν ἱερωσύνην εἰς τὸν Λευκίου Δομιτίου τ. τετελευτηκότος Nic. Dam. Fr. 127.4J., cf. D.H. 2.73; ἀναπληροῦν τὸν τ. τοῦ ἰδιώτου 1 Ep.Cor. 14.16; τ. ἔχειν also = have room (to grow), Thphr. HP 1.7.1; τόπῳ c. gen., in place of, instead of, Hdn. 2.14.5; ἀνὰ τόπον on the spot, immediately, E. Supp. 604 (lyr., dub.l.); so ἐν τόπῳ IG 12(7).515.63 ( Amorgos); ἐπὶ τόπου Plb. 4.73.8; ἐπὶ τῶν τ. PEnteux. 55.5 (iii B. C.), UPZ 70.16 (ii B.C.), CIL 3.567.3 ( Delph., ii B. C.), POxy. 2106.23 (iv A. D.), etc.; κατὰ τὸν αὐτὸν τ. S.E. P. 3.1; παρὰ τόπον at a wrong place, Str. 10.2.21, Arr. Epict. 3.21.16 (but παρὰ τ. καὶ παρὰ καιρόν by virtue of the place and the time, ib. 3.21.14).

data.quote: οὐ τὸν τρόπον, ἀλλὰ τὸν τ. μόνον μεταλλάξαι
Μερόλας ὁ αἱρεθεὶς ὕπατος εἰς τὸν τοῦ Κίννα τ.
ἐνεγράφη εἰς τὴν ἱερωσύνην εἰς τὸν Λευκίου Δομιτίου τ. τετελευτηκότος

children.definition: place or part of the body, Hp. Aph. 2.46, Loc.Hom. tit., Sor. 2.40, al., Gal. in titles of works, e.g. περὶ τῶν πεπονθότων τόπων, περὶ συνθέσεως φαρμάκων τῶν κατὰ τόπους; esp. ὁ τόπος, pudendum muliebre, Arist. HA 572b28, 583a15, cf. Sor. 2.62 (pl.).
place, passage in an author, κατὰ τόπους τινὰς τῆς ἱστορίας Plb. 12.25f.1, cf. Ph. 2.63, Ev.Luc. 4.17, Sor. 2.57, 58, etc.; the word is prob. interpolated in X. Mem. 2.1.20.

data.ref: 58, etc.; the word is prob. interpolated in

children.definition: burial-place, IG 12(7).401 ( Amorgos), al., Ev.Marc. 16.6; also in codd. of E. Heracl. 1041 (fort. leg. τάφον); later ὁ ἅγιος τ. is freq. of the grave of a martyr, or of a monastery associated with it, PMasp. 94.18 (vi A.D.), etc.

district, department, a sub-division of the νομός, = τοπαρχία, PMich.Zen. 43.8 (iii B. C.), Theb.Ostr. 27.2 (ii B. C.): but most freq. in pl., ὁ ἐπὶ τῶν τ. στρατηγός, πράκτωρ, etc., PEnteux. 27.9 (iii B. C.), PRein. 7.17, 35 (ii B. C.), etc.; οἱ ἔξω τ. dub. sens. in PEnteux. 87.2 (iii B. C.), BGU 1114.6 (i B. C.), etc.
room in a house, τόπον ἕνα ἄνευ ἐνοικίου ib. 896.4 (ii A. D.); δύο τόπους ἤτοι συμπόσια POxy. 1129.10 (V A.D.), cf. 502.34 (ii A. D.), 912.13 (iii A. D.).
position on the zodiac, Vett.Val. 139.13; esp. the twelve regions of 300, Ptol. Tetr. 128, Heph.Astr. 1.12.
αὐτὸς ὁ θεὸς καλεῖται τόπος, τῷ περιέχειν τὰ ὅλα Ph. 1.630, cf. Corp.Herm. 2.12, Hippol. Haer. 6.32.

data.quote: αὐτὸς ὁ θεὸς καλεῖται τόπος, τῷ περιέχειν τὰ ὅλα

children.label: II
children.definition: topic, Isoc. 5.109, 10.38, Aeschin. 3.216, Plb. 21.19.2, Phld. Rh. 1.119S., etc.
common-place or element in Rhetoric, ὁ τοῦ μᾶλλον καὶ ἧττον τ. Arist. Rh. 1358a14, cf. 1396b30, 1397a7; τὸ αὐτὸ λέγω στοιχεῖον καὶ τ. ib. 1403a18: pl., Phld. Rh. 1.226S.

data.quote: ὁ τοῦ μᾶλλον καὶ ἧττον τ.

children.label: b
children.definition: Hermog. Prog. 11; κοινὸς τ. ib. 6.

children.label: c
children.definition: sphere, ὁ πραγματικὸς τ. D.H. Comp. 1.

children.label: III
children.definition: opening, occasion, opportunity, ἐν τ. τινὶ ἀφανεῖ Th. 6.54 (but τρόπῳ is prob. cj.); ὀργῇ διδόναι τ. Plu. Cohib. 2.462b; μὴ δίδοτε τ. τῷ διαβόλῳ Ep.Eph. 4.27; δότε τ. τῇ ὀργῇ leave room for the wrath (of God), i.e. let God punish, Ep.Rom. 12.19; μὴ καταλείπεσθαί σφισι τ. ἐλέους Plb. 1.88.2; μετανοίας τ. οὐχ εὗρε Ep.Hebr. 12.17; οὐδὲ φυγῆς τόπον εὐμοιρήσαντες Hld. 6.13; τ. διδόναι τινί c. inf., give occasion to . . , LXX Si. 4.5.
to be warden of a τόπος I.6, Sammelb. 7433.3, 7, al. (v A. D.), PFlor. 295.11 (vi A. D.).
office of τοποτηρητής, Preisigke Berichtigungsliste p.102 (vi A. D.).
warden of a τόπος 1.6, Baillet Inscr. des tombeaux des rois à Thèbes 482, 788, PMonac. 6.11 (vi A. D.), etc.
= Lat. torale, bedcover, Cumont Fouilles de Doura-Europos 372 No. 13; cf. τολάριον.
vulture, Call. Fr. 204, Lyc. 357, 1080, prob. cj. in Muson. Fr. 18Ap.98H.

children.label: II
children.definition: τ. ὑγρόφοιτος, i.e. swan, Lyc. 88.

definition: τορδύλιον, τό, = sq., Dsc. 3.54 ( τόρδιλον, τορδίλιον codd.), Eup. 2.81.

children.definition: hartwort, Tordylium officinale, Ruf. ap. Orib. 7.26.118, Gal. 11.646, 13.176; tordylon, Plin. HN 24.177; cf. ὄρδειλον.
carving in relief, i.e. repoussé or chasing, Aristeas 58, Ph. 2.478, J. AJ 8.3.3, Plu. Aem. 32, Dem. 25.
rhetorical art, Poll. 6.141.
chased work, Hdn. Epim. 135.

definition: τορέλλη ἐπιφώνημα θρηνητικὸν σὺν αὐλῷ Θρᾳκικόν, Hsch.

children.definition: embossed work, work in relief (cf. τορεύω II), in pl., Men. 24, Sopat. 19; τ. ἀργυρᾶ καὶ χρυσᾶ D.S. 3.47; ὀστράκινα τ. Str. 8.6.23.

children.label: II
children.definition: E. HF 978 τόρ.ευμα (L2P2 ut vid.) is f.l. for τόρνευμα (LP).
boring tool used in making wells, Philyll. 18 as cited by Poll. 7.192, cf. 10.149 ( τόρος Eust., cf. Hsch., Phot.); γόμφων τ. for boring holes for dowels, AP 6.205.8 ( Leon.).
caelatura, Gloss.; cf. τόρνευσις.
one who works in relief, Plb. 26.1.2, CIG 3306 ( Smyrna), D.H. Comp. 25, Sardis 7(1) No. 56.10 (ii A. D.); cf. τορνευτής.
of or for metal-work, skilled therein: but Lat. toreutice, sculpture in general, Plin. HN 34.54; opp. graphice (painting), ib. 35.77; cf. τορεύω II, and v. τορνευτικός.

data.ref: 35.77; cf. τορεύω II, and v. τορνευτικός.

children.definition: worked in relief, chased, ποτήριον Men. 977; σκύφος OGI 214.54 ( Milet., iii B.C.); ἅρμα D S. 18.27.

children.label: II
children.definition: elaborate, ἔπος AP 9.545 ( Crin.), cf. D.H. Comp. 25.
bore through: metaph., ᾠδὴν τ. sing a piercing strain, Ar. Th. 986 (lyr., τορνεύειν cj. Bentley).

children.label: II
children.definition: work metal, whether in repoussé or chasing, c. acc. materiae, τ. σίδηρον Str. 13.4.17; ἄργυρον Anacreont. 3,4: abs., Plu. Aem. 37.

represent in this manner, πόντον Anacreont. 55.1; μάχην Paus. 1.28.2; παιδίον Id. 5.17.4; ἐρέβινθον Plu. Apophth.reg. 2.204f; Σάτυρον Pl. Epigr. 21 Diehl; ζῷα τετορευμένα Callix. 2 ( -νευ- cod. A Ath., corr. Salm.); γράμμα τορευθέν AP 7.274 ( Honest.).

children.label: III
children.definition: D.H. Th. 24.—Freq. confounded with τορνεύω, cf. Callix. l.c. and v. supr. I.

definition: τορέω, the pres. only in Hsch. (except that ἀντιτοροῦντα occurs in h.Merc. 283): fut. -ήσω ( ἀντι-) ib. 178: aor. 1 part. τορήσας Sardis 7(1) No.83, ( ἀντι-) Il. 10.267: aor. 2 ἔτορον Il. (v. infr.); redupl. τετορήσας h.Merc. 119, cf. Hsch. s. vv. τέτορεν, τετόρῃ:— Pass., pf. τετόρημαι Nonn. (v. infr.): ( τόρος):—

children.definition: bore, pierce, ἔτορε ζωστῆρα Il. 11.236; τορήσας, v. supr.:— Pass., σπλάγχνα . . τετορημένα χαλκῷ Nonn. D. 5.26; ἔγχεϊ ib. 13.493.
proclaim in shrill piercing tones, irreg. fut. τετορήσω Ar. Pax 381; cf. τορεύω I, τορός.

children.label: II
children.definition: work, shape, χέλυν Arat. 269, cf. AP 9.162.
liable to be pierced: vulnerable, Lyc. 456.
wheel-rut, Lyc. 262 (= τὸ χάραγμα τὸ ἀπὸ τοῦ τροχοῦ Sch.):— τόρμη· εὐθὺς δρόμος κατὰ τέχνην, καὶ στροφή, καὶ σύμπας ( δρόμος), Hsch.

children.label: II
children.definition: socket, joint, βουβῶνος ἐν τόρμαισι Lyc. 487.
parts mortised, Hero Bel. 94.12.
τορμίς· ἡ δέσποινα, Hsch.
hole or socket, in which a pin or peg is stuck, Hdt. 4.72, D.S. 2.8; mortise, Inscr.Délos 504 A 7 (iii B. C.), IG 2(2).1672.175; nave of a wheel, like πλήμνη, Hsch., Phot.

children.label: II
children.definition: tenon, Ph. Bel. 55.11, 64.15, Hero Bel. 95.5, Apollod. Poliorc. 178.2.
projecting peg or pivot, Hero Bel. 88.4.— Dim. τορμίον, τό, small projecting peg, Ph. Bel. 75.42.
crooked timber for shipbuilding, Thphr. HP 5.7.3.
whirling motion, as of a lathe; cf. τόρευμα II.
turnerʼs chips or shavings. Hp. Ulc. 12, IG ΙΙ(2).287 A 23 ( Delos, iii B. C.), Dsc. 1.80, Ruf. Ren.Ves. 8.5.
Il. 18.590 (fort. τόρευσις).
turnerʼs chisel, Thphr. HP 5.6.4.
turner, IG 1(2).374.355, Aristox. Harm. p.33 M., Sammelb. 3950, 5480, v.l. for τορευτής in M.Ant. 5.1; τορνευταί· γλύπται, Hsch.
of or for turning on a lathe: ἡ -κή (sc. τέχνη) v.l. for τορευ- in M.Ant. 5.1.
lyre-turner and shield-maker, Com. word in Ar. Av. 491 (anap.).

definition: τορνευτός (also τορονευτός, q. v.), ή, όν,

children.definition: turned on a lathe, ποτήρια Men. 977, cf. PLond. 2.402v. 31 (ii B. C.), Sch. Od. 1.440: written τορυνευτός, Arch.Pap. 1.64 (ii B. C.).

children.label: II
children.definition: fit for turning, λίθοι Thphr. Lap. 5.

work with a lathe or chisel, turn, Pl. Criti. 113d; κρίκους ἐκ πυρῆνος Thphr. HP 4.2.7, cf. 5.3.2 ( Pass.); πομφόλυγας IG 1(2).373.254; τοὺς πόλους τ. στρογγύλους ib. 2(2).1675.22:— Med., κυκλοτερὲς αὐτὸ ἐτορνεύσατο Pl. Ti. 33b:— Pass., Thphr. Lap. 42, Hero Aut. 26.7, J. AJ 3.7.6.
turn neatly, round off, Ar. Th. 54, cf. Plu. Aem. 37.

children.label: II
children.definition: turn round, as a carpenter turns an auger, E. Cyc. 661 (lyr.).—Cf. τορεύω fin.
grape, Poll. 6.82: hence τόρνιος οἶνος Hp. Morb. 2.47.

definition: τορνίσκος, ὁ, Dim. (in form) of τόρνος, Ph. Bel. 53.4, IG ΙΙ(2).161 A 105 ( Delos, iii B. C.).

children.definition: describe a circle, Sch.BT Il. 23.255.
shaped like a circle, rounded, Eust. ad D.P. 157.

mark off with the τόρνος, make round, τορνώσαντο σῆμα they rounded off the barrow, Il. 23.255; ὅσσον τίς τʼ ἔδαφος νηὸς τορνώσεται large as the bottom of a ship which a man shall round off, with allusion to the round shape of a merchant vessel (cf. γαῦλος), opp. to a ship of war, Od. 5.249, cf. D.P. 1170, Tryph. 64.— Act. τορνῶσαι· περιγράψαι, κυκλῶσαι, Hsch., who also has Pass. τορνοῦμαι δὲ πρὸς μέτρον· ἀντὶ τοῦ περιγράφομαι (perh. a Trag. fragment).

carpenterʼs tool for drawing a circle, like our compasses, prob. a pin at the end of a string, Lat. tornus ( Plin. HN 7.198), Thgn. 805; κυκλοτερὴς ὡς ἀπὸ τόρνου (of the representation of the earth in early maps) Hdt. 4.36; τροχὸς τόρνῳ γραφόμενος E. Ba. 1067 (perh. in signf. II); κύκλος τις ὡς τόρνοισιν ἐκμετρούμενος Id. Fr. 382.3.
κύκλου τ. the centre of a circle, X. Vect. 1.6.

children.label: II
children.definition: turning-lathe, βόμβυκας τόρνου κάματον A. Fr. 57.3 (anap.); καθάπερ τῆς ἐν τόρνψ κυκλοφορουμένης σφαίρας as of a ball being turned in a lathe, Arist. Mu. 391b22; τὰ τοῖς τόρνοις γιγνόμενα ἐπίπεδά τε καὶ στερεά Pl. Phlb. 51c, cf. 56c; ὁ Ἰουδαϊκὸς λίθος . . ἔχων γραμμὰς παραλλήλους ὡς ἀπὸ τόρνου Dsc. 5.137; metae . . ex torno ita perfectae, ut alia in aliam inire convenireque possit, Vitr. 9.8.6, cf. 10.7.3; ἄξων ἀπὸ τόρνου εἰργασμένος Hero Spir. 1.16, cf. Aut. 11.2.

children.label: III
children.definition: that which is turned, circle, round, D.P. 157.
rounded with the τόρνος, turned, Hdn.Gr. 1.221.
tool used by a worker in relief, prob. drill, IG 11(2).199 A 86 ( Delos, iii B. C.).
Edict.Diocl. 15.43.
piercing:

children.label: I
children.definition: piercing, thrilling, Luc. Bacch. 7, Alciphr. 3.48; τὸ τ. τῆς φωνῆς Porph. Plot. 2: metaph., τ. φόβος thrilling fear, A. Ch. 32 (lyr.). Adv., τορῶς γεγωνεῖν E. Ion 696 (lyr.): neut. as Adv., τορὸν ἠχεῖν, βοᾶν, Philostr. VS 1.25.10, Her. 19.12.

children.label: b
children.definition: acute, fine, AP 7.409 ( Antip. Thess.).

children.label: c
children.definition: piercing, Opp. C. 1.181.

clear, distinct, plain, ἑρμηνεύς A. Ag. 1062, cf. 616; ἔπος, μῦθος, ib. 1162 (lyr.), Supp. 274; τορὸν γὰρ ἥξει Id. Ag. 254 (lyr.); τ. ὕμνοι dub. cj. in AP 4.1.7 ( Mel.); ἐρέω τι τορώτερον (cj. for τομώτερον) Call. Del. 94. Adv., ἀλλὰ τορῶς ταῦτʼ ἴσθι Emp. 23.11; τ. τέκμηρον, λέξω, A. Pr. 604 (lyr.), 609, etc.; προυζεπίστασθαι ib. 699; ἐπεξελθεῖν ib. 870; ἀπαγγεῖλαι, φράσαι, Id. Ag. 632, 1584; οὐκ ἴσμεν τ. E. Rh. 77; ἀκούσας οὐ τ. ib. 656.

children.label: II
children.definition: sharp, ready, smart, X. Lac. 2.11 ( Sup.), D.H. Rh. 11.5, cj. in Call. Fr. 78 ( Sup.). Adv., ἐπερείδεσθαι τορῶς Ar. Ra. 1102 (troch.); τ. τε καὶ ὀξέως διακονεῖν Pl. Tht. 175e, Luc. Anach. 21, Merc.Cond. 35: Sup. -ώτατα Ael. NA 1.43.
borer, drill, used in trying for water, etc., Philyll. 18 (v. τορεύς), IG 2(2).1673.36,54.
a birdʼs note, Ar. Av. 267; τοροτοροτοροτοροτίξ ib. 260; τοροτοροτοροτορολιλιλίξ ib. 262 (all lyr.).

definition: τόρτυρα τῶν κεραμίων προμήκης πυθμήν, Hsch. (perh. f.l. for γόργυρα).

children.definition: Hp. Int. 44, Eub. 86, Dsc. Eup. 2.54, Dieuch. ap. Orib. 4.7.18, Gal. 6.498, etc.
stirrer, ladle for stirring things while boiling, Sophr. 110, Ar. Eq. 984 (lyr.), Av. 78; χρυσῆ τ. ἢ συκίνη Pl. Hp.Ma. 290d.

children.label: II
children.definition: τορύνη· σιτῶδές τι, Hsch. [ ῡ in Ar. ll. cc., but ῠ in AP 6.305 ( Leon.): nothing can be proved from Eup. 370.]
stirred about, Cael.Aur. TP 1.1.
stir up or about, Ar. Eq. 1172.

children.label: II
children.definition: = insculpo, Gloss.
so many years long, πόλεμος Eust. 222.37.
so many times, so often, Polyaen. 4.3.9; Ep. τοσσάκι Il. 21.268, 22.197, Simon. 145, etc.; elided, τοσσάχʼ ὕδωρ Od. 11.586.
Porph. in Harm. p.325 W.
And. 4.36, Pl. R. 546c, Arist. Ph. 237b32, etc.

so many fold, so many times or so much more, corresponding to relat. ὁσαπλάσιος, Arist. Pr. 917b23, 929b14; the same multiple as, Euc. 5.1, Archim. Sph.Cyl. 1.2, etc.:—also τοσαυτα-πλᾰσίων, ον, gen. ονος, Id. Aequil. 1.6, al., Theo Sm. p.76H.
in so many ways, Arist. APr. 48b3, Metaph. 1022a11, Thphr. HP 8.7.5, D.H. Lys. 14, Alex.Aphr. in Top. 61.13.

definition: τόσος, Ep. τόσσος, η, ον (both forms in Hom. (v. infr.) and Hes. ( Op. 680, 711, Th. 705), the latter form also in Trag. (lyr.), S. Aj. 184), Demonstr. corresponding to the Relat. ὅσος and interrog. πόσος:—of Size, Space, and Quantity,

children.definition: so great, so vast: of Time, so long: of Number, pl., so many: of Sound, so loud: generally of Degree, so much, so very:—freq. answered by the Relat. ὅσος, οὔ τι τόσος γε ὅσος Τελαμώνιος Αἴας Il. 2.528; κακὸν τόσον ὅσσον ἐτύχθη 17.410, cf. Hes. Op. 680: sts. with an Adv. as relat., τόσων . . ὡς . . A. Ag. 866: freq. abs., when it either refers to something already mentioned, so great or so many, Il. 9.546, 21.321, or to a well-known magnitude, which may be great or small, acc. to the context, just so much or just so many, Od. 14.100, 22.144, Hes. Th. 705, etc.: with numeral Adverbs, τρὶς τόσσα . . δῶρα thrice as many, Il. 1.213, cf. 9.379, 21.80, 24.686; δὶς τόσα τείνυσθαι Hes. Op. 711; δὶς τόσον [κακόν] Thgn. 1090; δὶς τόσʼ ἐξ ἁπλῶν κακά S. Aj. 277; τόσαι τρίς Alex. 187.1.— Τόσος is used thus only in Poets, τοσόσδε or τοσοῦτος being used in Att. Prose, exc. in the neut., v. infr. II.

data.quote: ὅσος, οὔ τι τόσος γε ὅσος Τελαμώνιος Αἴας

data.ref: A. Ag. 866: freq. abs., when it either refers to something already mentioned,
21.321, or to a well-known magnitude, which may be great or small, acc. to the context,
Hes. Th. 705, etc.: with numeral Adverbs,

children.definition: ὅσος, Pi. N. 4.5, B. 15.11, Call. Ap. 94.

children.label: II
children.definition: Hom. τόσον and τόσσον are common as Adv. with Verbs and Adverbs, so much, so far, so very; with a relat., τόσσον . . , ὅσον Il. 3.12, cf. 6.450, al.; τόσσον . . , ὡς . . 22.424; τόσον . . , ὡς ὅτε . . 4.130: freq. abs., λίην τ. so very, Od. 4.371, 15.405; τόσσον πολλόν so very far, Il. 20.178; τ. πλέες so many more, 2.129; τ. φέρτερος Od. 21.372; τόσσον . . πεπείρημαι Hes. Op. 660; δὶς τόσσον . . ἀπῆμεν Od. 9.491, cf. A. Ag. 140 (lyr.), Eu. 896, etc.: in Prose, τόσον νυνὶ φρόνει . . ὅσονπερ τότε prob. in Lys. Oxy. 1606.194 ( Bodl.Quart.Record 5.303); τόσα καὶ τόσα so and so many, Pl. Phdr. 271d; ἔτη τ. καὶ τ. D. 57.29; ζημιοῦσθαι τόσῳ καὶ τόσῳ Pl. Lg. 721d.
ἐκ τόσου ever since (that), always of Time, freq. in Hdt., as 5.88, 6.84, cf. Pl. Lg. 642e; ἀπολήμψῃ ἐν τόσῳ in the meantime, POxy. 298.17 (i A. D.).
ἐς τόσον so far, ὁκόταν ἐς τ. προΐωσι τοῦ χρόνου . . , πρότερον ἢ ἐς τ. ἀφικέσθαι Hp. Mul. 2.133; εἰς τόσον ἔδεισαν IG 12(3).174.28 ( Cnidus, i B.C., Epist. Augusti); ἐπὶ τόσσον A.R. 3.1146.

data.quote: ὁκόταν ἐς τ. προΐωσι τοῦ χρόνου . . , πρότερον ἢ ἐς τ. ἀφικέσθαι

children.definition: ὅσῳ μᾶλλον . . , τόσῳ . . , with a Comp., Th. 4.28; ὅσῳ ἐπὶ τὸ μεῖζον . . , τόσῳ ἐχυρώτερον . . Id. 8.24, cf. Pl. Lg. 665e, etc.; ὅσῳπερ . . , τόσῳ . . ib. 902e; ὅσῳ . . , τόσῳ δὲ . . (Hertlein for τοσῷδε) Th. 1.37.
τόσον only, Opp. C. 2.183; so τόσσον PSI 9.1030.16 (ii A.D.). (Cf.Lat. tantum.)

children.label: III
children.definition: Adv. τόσως, δὶς τ. ἐμὲ κτείνας ἀδελφῆς E. El. 1092, cf. Med. 1194.

data.quote: τόσως, δὶς τ. ἐμὲ κτείνας ἀδελφῆς

children.definition: Hom. has both common and Ep. forms ( Il. 2.120, Od. 5.100), but not so freq. as τόσος or τόσσος, while in Att. τοσόσδε and τοσοῦτος are the regul. forms, the latter being most freq. in Prose:—in Ep., τοιόσδε τοσόσδε τε joined, Il. l.c. :— τοσόνδε μέντοι χάρισαί μοι Pl. R. 457e; ἀλλά μοι ἔτι τ. εἰπέ ib. 330d, cf. Hdt. 1.13, etc.; and with Art., τὸ δὲ τ. οἶδα, ὅτι . . Pl. Lg. 672b: c. inf., τοσσήνδε θεοὶ δύναμιν περιθεῖεν τείσασθαι μνηστῆρας sufficient to punish . . , Od. 3.205: with an answering ὅσσος, Il. 14.94, 18.430: τοσοίδε ὄντες being so many only, i.e. so few, X. An. 2.4.4.

data.ref: Od. 5.100), but not so freq. as

children.label: II
children.definition: τοσόνδε, Ep. τοσσόνδε, as Adv., so very, so much, Od. 21.253; folld. by ὅσσον, Il. 22.41: also in Trag. (not in E.), S. El. 403, etc.; τ. ὅσον . . A. Th. 772 (lyr.), etc.; τ. ὥστε . . S. Aj. 1335: of Time, so long, τ. ὅσον περ . . A. Ag. 860; ἐς τ. S. OT 1212 (lyr.); τοσσάδε Pi. O. 1.116.
Subst., ἐς τοσόνδε τοῦ χρόνου S. El. 961, cf. 14; τὸ τοσόνδε quantity, Arist. Ph. 224b6.
Alex. 16.11; in a mathematical demonstration, Pl. Men. 83d; τ. μῆκος ἢ τ. Arist. Cael. 276b24.
of so large a number, πλῆθος A. Pers. 432.
so many times as great, Iamb. in Nic. p.97 P.

definition: τοσοῦτος, αύτη, οῦτο (or τοσοῦτον, v. sub fin.); Ep. τοσσοῦτος; Aeol. τεσσοῦτος (q. v.);

children.definition: Hom. has both common and Ep. forms, but not so freq. as τόσος or τόσσος, while in Trag. (not in E.) it is common, and in Prose the prevailing form, cf. τοσόσδε:—freq. answered by the Relat. ὅσος, S. Ph. 1076, Pl. R. 330b, etc.; by ὁπόσος, Id. Smp. 214a, etc.; by ὅστις, Hdt. 7.49; also by Adv. ὡς, Od. 21.402; τ. ἐγένετο ὥστε . . X. Cyn. 1.9: freq. also, like τοσόσδε, abs., ἄφενος τ. Od. 14.99; of persons, so large, so tall, etc., καί σε τ. ἔθηκα Il. 9.485; also, so great (in rank, skill, or character), S. Tr. 1140, Pl. Smp. 177c, etc.; τ. καὶ τοιοῦτον τὸ θεῖον ὥσθʼ ἅμα πάνθʼ ὁρᾶν X. Mem. 1.4.18; τηλικοῦτος καὶ τ. Pl. Smp. 177a: pl., so many, τ. ἔτεα Il. 2.328; [ χρήματα] Od. 13.258: with a qualifying word, mostly in acc., μεγάθεα τοσοῦτοι so big, Hdt. 7.103; τοσοῦτος τὸ βάθος so deep, X. An. 3.5.7; τοσοῦτοι τὸ πλῆθος Arist. Pol. 1283b12; τὴν ἡλικίαν Plu. Arat. 50; also τοσοῦτος ἐν κακίᾳ (v.l. εἰς κακίαν) Luc. Alex. 1; τοσοῦτος ἡλικίας Plu. Cat.Mi. 69 (s. v. l.): with numeral Advbs., δὶς τ., πολλάκις τ., etc., Th. 6.37, Pl. R. 330b, etc.; also ἕτερον τοσοῦτο of the same height, Hdt. 2.149; ἕτεροι or ἄλλοι τοσοῦτοι to the same number, And. 3.7, X. HG 4.1.21: εἰς τοσούτους τεταγμένοι drawn up only so few in file (opp. οὕτω βαθεῖα φάλαγξ), Id. Cyr. 6.3.22, cf. Isoc. 9.29.

data.ref: X. Cyn. 1.9: freq. also, like τοσόσδε, abs.,

data.quote: τ. καὶ τοιοῦτον τὸ θεῖον ὥσθʼ ἅμα πάνθʼ ὁρᾶν

data.ref: Od. 13.258: with a qualifying word, mostly in acc.,

children.label: II
children.definition: Subst., so much, thus much, τοσσοῦτον ὀνήσιος Od. 21.402, cf. S. OT 836, OC 790; τ. οἶδα Id. Aj. 748, cf. 441, etc.; referring to what precedes, τοσαῦτα . . εἰρήσθω Hdt. 3.113; τοσαῦτʼ ἔλεξε A. Pers. 372, cf. Pr. 621, Ag. 680, etc.: freq. with Preps., διὰ τοσούτου at so small a distance, so near at hand, Th. 2.29; ἐς τοσοῦτο (ν) so far, Hdt. 3.113, 6.134; ἐς τ. ἥκομεν, ὥστε . . Lys. 27.10; ἐς τ. ἐλπίδων βεβώς S. OT 771, cf. OC 748, Ar. Nu. 832, Pl. Ap. 25e, etc.; ἐκ τ. from so far, so far off, X. HG 4.4.16; ἐν τοσούτῳ in the meantime, Ar. Eq. 420, Th. 6.64; ἐπὶ τοσοῦτο so far, Hdt. 6.97, Arist. Pol. 1300a9; κατὰ τοσοῦτον so far, Lys. 31.8, Pl. Prm. 129a, etc.; μέχρι τοσούτου ἕως ἂν . . so far, so long, Th. 1.90, cf. X. Cyr. 1.4.23; παρὰ τοσοῦτον ἐλθεῖν κινδύνου Th. 3.49, 7.2, cf. 6.37: τοσούτου δέω, v. δέω (B) I.2.

children.label: III
children.definition: Adv., so much, so far, ἢ τοσσοῦτον . . ἢ ἔτι μᾶσσον Od. 8.203; τ. ὀδύρομαι 21.250; σθένειν τ. ὥστε . . S. Ant. 453, etc.; τοσοῦτον, ὅσον . . Th. 3.49, cf. 1.11, 88, X. An. 3.1.45, etc.: pl., τοσαῦτα μάχεσθαι ὅσα ἀναγκάζονται Th. 7.81, cf. Pl. Alc. 1.108a: with Adjs., τοσοῦτον φιλέλλην Sor. Vit.Hippocr. 8; νεώτατος τ. Il. 23.476; τ. εὐτυχέστεροι Lys. 2.16:—but τοσούτῳ is more freq. with Comparatives, Hdt. 7.49, Pl. R. 576b, X. HG 4.8.4, etc.; or with words implying comparison, τοσούτῳ διέφερεν ὥστε . . ib. 3.1.10, cf. An. 1.5.9. (The neut. is τοσοῦτον ( Ep. also τοσσοῦτον) in Il. 23.476, Od. 14.99, A. Pr. 621, S. OT 771, al., and Att. generally (very freq. in Pl., Prt. 314b, al., but τοσοῦτο is found in Tht. 153a as cited by Anon. in Tht.): τοσοῦτο is found in Pi. I. 2.35 ( τοσοῦθʼ ὅσον) and in A. Eu. 201, 427, Ar. Nu. 832, where τοσοῦτον (which is v.l. in Ar. l.c.) is metrically possible; also in Hdt. (passim) and as v.l. in cod. B of Th. 7.59 and codd. CG of Id. 8.76, in all codd. of Lys. 3.34, 6.17 and in the first hand of cod. X in 14.2, also in D. 28.12; so later, PCair.Zen. 367.38, PMich.Zen. 28.17 (both iii B. C.), Phld. Ir. p.47 W., Rh. 1.206S.; τοσοῦτʼ ἐπʼ αὐτούς D.S. 14.23; τοσοῦτʼ ἀπέχειν Aristid. Or. 36(48).100.)

data.ref: X. HG 4.8.4, etc.; or with words implying comparison,
6.17 and in the first hand of cod. X in

definition: τοσουτοσί, τοσαυτηΐ, τοσουτονί, later Att. for τοσοῦτος, with a stronger demonstr. force, Ar. Pl. 427, Pl. Hp.Ma. 292c, D. 18.279, etc.
τόσσαις, Aeol. for τόσσας, aor. part. of an unknown pres.

children.definition: happen to be, Pi. P. 3.27 (just as τυχών is used, ib. 4.5); inf., τόσσαι καλῶν Id. Fr. 22; cf. ἐπέτοσσε.

definition: τοσσάτιος [ᾰ], η, ον, late Ep. for τόσος,

children.definition: so great, so much, AP 9.425 ( Barb.), Androm. ap. Gal. 14.41: neut. τοσσάτιον so wide a tract, τ. ναίοντες, ὅσον . . D.P. 363; so long, χρόνος A.R. 4.962: pl., so many, AP 7.56. (No form τοσάτιος occurs.)

definition: τοσσῆνος, Dor. for τοσοῦτος, Theoc. 1.54, v.l. in Id. 3.51. (No form τοσῆνος occurs.)
τόσσος, τοσσόσδε, Ep. for τόσος, τοσόσδε.
τοσσοῦτος, αύτη, οῦτον, Ep. for τοσοῦτος.

τότε, Dor. τόκᾰ (q. v.) (both forms in Pi. ( τότε P. 2.89, τόκα O. 6.66) and Theoc. ( τότε 13.23, τόκα 7.154)); Aeol. τότᾰ Alc. Oxy. 1789 Fr. 1i12 ( τόκα acc. to codd. of Theoc. 29.39, cf. ποτα, ὄτα):—

children.definition: Adv. at that time, then, corresponding to Relat. ὅτε or ὁπότε (infr. I.5), and to interrog. πότε; mostly of some point in past time, opp. νῦν, Il. 15.724, etc.: c. gen., τ. τοῦ χειμῶνος Th. 7.31: also of a future time, τότε κέν μιν . . πεπίθοιμεν Il. 1.100, cf. 4.182; λέξεις καὶ τότʼ εἴσομαι S. OT 1517 (troch.) (or of imagined circumstances, in that case (cf. νῦν I.4), Pl. R. 334c); sts., then, next, πρῶτον μὲν . . , εἶτα . . , καὶ τ . . . D. 24.48:—in Trag. and Att. also in indef. sense, formerly, καὶ νῦν θʼ ὁμοίως καὶ τότʼ ἐξεπίσταμαι S. El. 907, cf. Ant. 391, Aj. 650, Ar. Pl. 1117, Lys. 1023 (lyr.); ὃ δὴ καὶ τότε ἐλέγομεν just now, Pl. Tht. 157a; τ. μὲν . . , νῦν δὲ . . A. Ag. 799 (anap.), cf. E. Alc. 915 (anap.); νῦν . . τότʼ Id. Med. 1402 (anap.); ὁμοῖοι καὶ τ. καὶ νῦν Th. 1.86, cf. 3.40, D. 6.12; also τότʼ ἢ τόθʼ, ὅτε τὸ κύριον μόλῃ at one time or other, A. Ag. 766 (lyr.); συμφοραὶ . . βροτοῖσιν ἢ τότʼ ἦλθον ἢ τ. E. Andr. 853.

data.quote: καὶ νῦν θʼ ὁμοίως καὶ τότʼ ἐξεπίσταμαι
τότʼ ἢ τόθʼ, ὅτε τὸ κύριον μόλῃ
συμφοραὶ . . βροτοῖσιν ἢ τότʼ ἦλθον ἢ τ.

children.definition: καὶ τ. even then, or (at the beginning of a clause) and then, Il. 16.691, Hes. Op. 536, etc.; καὶ τ. δή Il. 1.92, Od. 8.299; καὶ τότʼ ἔπειτα Il. 1.426; καὶ τ. μέν 21.40; δὴ τ. Hes. Op. 417, Pi. O. 3.25, A. Th. 214 (lyr.), etc.; τ. δή ῥα Od. 9.52; τ. γʼ Il. 3.224, Od. 12.250; δὴ τ. γʼ 15.228; τ. δʼ ἤδη by that time, Il. 2.699; ἀλλὰ τότʼ ἤδη when that time comes, Hes. Op. 588, cf. A. Pr. 911, Lys. 12.66, etc.: repeated with emphasis, τότʼ ἄρα τ. S. Ant. 1273 (lyr.); τ. δὴ τ. D. 18.47.

ἄνδρες οἱ τ. people then living, the men of that time, Il. 9.559, etc.; οἱ τότʼ ἐόντες ἀοιδοί Pi. I. 4(3).27(45); ὁ τ. τυραννεύων Hdt. 1.20; οἱ τ. ἄνθρωποι Id. 8.8; ἡ τ. ἀρωγή A. Ag. 73 (anap.); τῇ τόθʼ ἡμέρᾳ S. El. 1134; ὁ τ. κόσμος 2 Ep.Pet. 3.6; ἐν τῷ τ. Th. 1.92, Pl. Criti. 110d; ἐν τῷ τ. χρόνῳ ib. 111e ( χρόνῳ om. cod. A), Plt. 270e; εἰς τὸν τ. χρόνον Id. Lg. 740c.

εἰς τ. with fut., on the day, then (v. εἰς II.2), ἔμπροσθεν τοῦ ἀγῶνος ἐμανθάνομεν . . ἂν μάχεσθαι . . , μιμούμενοι πάντα ἐκεῖνα ὁπόσοις ἐμέλλομεν εἰς τ. χρήσεσθαι ib. 830b, cf. D. 14.24, etc.; ἐκ τ. or ἔκτοτε (q. v.) from that time, Plu. Caes. 48, Arr. An. 1.26.4; so ἀπὸ τ. LXX Ps. 92(93).2, Ev.Matt. 4.17.

ὅτε, S. OC 778, etc.; to ὅταν, A. Ag. 971, Ar. Av. 1116 (troch.); to ὁππότε, Il. 16.244, Od. 23.257; to ὁππότε κεν or ὁπότʼ ἂν δή, Il. 9.702, 21.341; to ἀλλʼ ὅτε δή, ib. 451; to εἰ, 4.36; to ἐπεί κε, 11.192; to ἡνίκα, S. Aj. 773: also after a part., like εἶτα, πάντα ἐάσαντες καὶ μόνον οὐχὶ συγκατασκευάσαντες αὐτῷ τ . . . ζητήσομεν; D. 3.17, cf. 9.73 (interpol.), etc.: freq. joined with other Particles, δὴ τ. after ἦμος, Il. 1.476; after αὐτὰρ ἐπεί, 12.17; after ὁππότε κεν, Od. 10.294; also καὶ τ. δή after ἦμος, Il. 8.69, Od. 9.59; after ἀλλʼ ὅτε δή, Il. 22.209, Od. 4.461; δή ῥα τ. after εὖτʼ ἄν, Hes. Op. 565; τότʼ ἔπειτα after αὐτὰρ ἐπὴν δή, ib. 616; καὶ τότʼ ἔπειτα after ἦμος, Il. 1.478.

data.ref: 9.73 (interpol.), etc.: freq. joined with other Particles,

children.label: II
children.definition: ὅτε, Nic. Al. 422, 595.

definition: τοτέ (with changed accent, cf. ὅτε, ὁτέ), Adv.

children.definition: at times, now and then, in answering clauses, τοτὲ μὲν . . , τοτὲ δὲ . . (much like ποτὲ μὲν . . , ποτὲ δὲ . . ) at one time . . , at another . . , Od. 24.447, A. Ag. 100 (anap.), S. OC 1745 (lyr.), Ar. Eq. 540 (anap.), Pl. Plt. 270a, al.; τόκα μὲν . . , τόκα δέ ( Dor. parox.) Pi. N. 6.10; τότʼ ἄλλος, ἄλλοθʼ ἅτερος S. El. 739; τ. μὲν . . , ἄλλοτε δὲ . . Pl. Phdr. 237e, Poet. ap. X. Mem. 1.2.20; τ. μὲν . . , αὖθις δὲ . . Pl. Grg. 491b, etc.; τ. μὲν δίκαιον, ὅταν δὲ βούληται, ἄδικον Id. Phdr. 261d, cf. A. Ch. 412 (lyr.):— τοτὲ μέν in the first clause is sts. omitted, Il. 11.63, Pl. Phd. 116a, Tht. 192d.

data.quote: τ. μὲν δίκαιον, ὅταν δὲ βούληται, ἄδικον

children.definition: a birdʼs note, Ar. Av. 243.

definition: τοτοῖ, Interj. in Trag. lyr., A. Pers. 551, 561; τοτοτοῖ, S. Tr. 1010; cf. ὀτοτοῖ.
τού, τούγα, τούν, τούνη, v. σύ.

children.definition: for that reason, therefore, Il. 1.291, al., Hes. Op. 49, Pi. O. 1.65; also τοὔνεκεν, Xenoph. 2.19, A.R. 1.1354, D.P. 950, etc.

here, Epimenid. ap. D.L. 1.113.

definition: τουτάκις [ᾰ], poet. Adv. for τότε, antec. to ὁπόταν, Thgn. 844: abs., Pi. P. 4.255, 9.14, Call. Cer. 33, etc.: also τουτάκι, Pi. P. 4.28, Isyll. 67, Call. Jov. 44, Hec. 1.2.8.

children.label: II

definition: τουτεῖ (perispom. acc. to A.D. Synt. 238.9, but apparently τουτεί in codd.), Dor. Adv.

children.definition: here, IG 42(1).122.25 ( Epid., iv B. C.), 9(1).977.3 (Corc., iii B. C.), Theoc. 5.45, 103: but τουτει prob. = τουτί in τουτει καλύπτει μνῆμα Μελανώπου δέμας Supp.Epigr. 4.192 ( Halic., i B. C.).
that is to say, Ev.Marc. 7.2, Plu. Adul. 2.64c, Heph. 12.1, A.D. Synt. 29.13, Cod.Just. 1.1.5.3, etc.; f.l. in Arist. Fr. 94 (codd. SM Stob.).
A.
from here, A.D. Adv. 163.24, 190.20, cj. in Erinn. 3.1; also τουτόθε, Theoc. 4.10.
from here, from there, Sophr. 85, SIG 1025.28 ( Cos, iv/iii B. C.), GDI 5075 A 53, al. ( Crete); Lacon. acc. to Hsch.
thence, Theoc. 4.48.
a tufa quarry, Tab.Heracl. 1.137. (Lat. tōfus, prob. borrowed from an Italic dialect.)

up to or during that time, so long, Hom., answering to relat. ὄφρα, which follows, Il. 11.754, Od. 4.289 (so ὄφρʼ ἄν with subj., Il. 1.509, al.); but the relat. commonly precedes, ὄφρα . . , τ . . . in (the course of) that time, so long . . , 18.381, Od. 20.330, h.Cer. 37; ὄφρʼ ἂν . . , τ . . . Il. 7.194, Od. 5.362, al.; ὄφρα . . τ. δὲ . . Il. 4.221, Od. 10.126:—besides the regular ὄφρα . . , τόφρα . . we find τ . . . , ἕως . . 5.122; τ . . . , ἕως κε . . 2.77; more freq. ἕως . . , τ . . . , Il. 15.392, Od. 12.328, al.; ἕως . . , τ. δὲ . . Il. 10.507, Od. 5.425, etc.; ἀλλʼ ὅτε δὴ . . , τ . . . 10.571; πρὶν . . , τ . . . Il. 21.101; εὖτε . . , τ. δὲ . . Od. 20.77.

eatable, Hdn.Gr. 2.912, EM 731.15.

of or from the Epirotic city Τραγασαί, Hellanic. 34J., Str. 13.1.48, Poll. 6.63.

Gal. 4.633, UP 14.7, Alex.Aphr. Pr. 1.125.

goat-stag, a fantastic animal, represented on Eastern carpets and the like, Ar. Ra. 937; οἱ γραφῆς τραγελάφους καὶ τὰ τοιαῦτα μειγνύντες γράφουσιν Pl. R. 488a, cf. Arist. APr. 49a24, APo. 92b7; ποῦ ἐστὶ τ. ἢ σφίγξ; Id. Ph. 208a30.

C.).

definition: τράγημα [ ᾰγ], ατος, τό, mostly in pl.,

D.), etc.; ὀνομάζω τ. τὰ παρὰ τὸ δεῖπνον ἐσθιόμενα τῆς ἐπὶ τῷ πίνειν ἡδονῆς ἕνεκα Gal. 6.550; called δευτέρα τράπεζα, Arist. Fr. 104; κάρυα καὶ τ. Clearch.Com. 4; κάρυα καὶ . . καστάναια καὶ κυάμους Αἰγύπτου . . καὶ εἴ τινα ἄλλα τ. IG 2(2).1013.20 (ii B. C.); καὶ τ. που παραθήσομεν αὐτοῖς τῶν τε σύκων καὶ ἐρεβίνθων καὶ κυάμων Pl. R. 372c: metaph., Lyc. Fr. 3; τ. τῶν λόγων D.H. Rh. 10.18: less freq. in sg., Alex. 250, Diph. 79, Crobyl. 9, Arist. l.c., Aret. CD 1.2.

children.definition: of or for tragedy, tragic, χοροί Hdt. 5.67; σκευή, σκηνή, etc., Pl. R. 577b, X. Cyr. 6.1.54, etc.; τ. ποιηταί Aeschin. 3.231, cf. SIG 692.32 ( Delph., ii B. C.); τ. αὐλητής, συναγωνισταί, OGI 51.62, 56 ( Ptolemais, iii B. C.); τ. ἀνήρ, = τραγῳδός III, Pl. Phd. 115a; so οἱ τ. Arist. Rh. 1415a18 (but ὁ τ. specially of Euripides, Ph. 2.53, 469; he is called -ώτατος τῶν ποιητῶν Arist. Po. 1453a29); σπουδὴ τ. the seriousness of tragedy, Pl. Lg. 838c; τ. λῆρος tragic trumpery, Ar. Ra. 1005; ἡ τ. ποίησις serious poetry (cf. τραγῳδία II), Pl. R. 602b; ἡ τ. Arist. Rh. 1403b22; τὰ τ. Pl. R. 595c, Phdr. 269a.
tragic, stately, majestic, ὅπως ἐφαίνου . . -ώτερος Ar. Pax 136; τ. γάρ ἐστιν ἡ ἀπόκρισις Pl. Men. 76e; διὰ τὸ σεμνὸν καὶ τ. pathos, Arist. Rh. 1406b8, cf. Po. 1456a21, Pr. 918a10.
pompous, εἴσοδος Plb. 5.26.9, cf. Plu. Alex. fort. 2.330a, Luc. Im. 21; ranting, D. 18.313: prov., τ. πίθηκος, ἐπὶ τῶν παρʼ ἀξίαν σεμνυνομένων, Hsch.

children.label: III
children.definition: Adv. -κῶς in tragic or stately style, τ. λέγειν Pl. R. 413b, 545e; ἵνα σοι καὶ -ώτερον λαλῶ Men. 531.8; -ώτερον ποιεῖν Luc. Pisc. 39, cf. Hist.Conscr. 16; -ώτερον οἰκεῖν to be housed in stately fashion, Plu. Publ. 10.
of tragic kind, μῦθος Palaeph. 40.
of a he-goat, κόραι AP 9.558 ( Eryc.).
a plant smelling like a he-goat, stinking tutsan, Hypericum hircinum, Dsc. 4.49.

children.label: II
children.definition: pimpinell, Pimpinella Tragium, ib. 50.

definition: Τράγιος [ ᾰ], ὁ, name of month at Melitea in Thessaly, IG 9(2).206 I b 15.

children.definition: Dim. of τράγος, young he-goat, Theoc. 5.141, AP 9.317: also τρᾰγ-ίσκιον, Hsch. s.v. ἐξάγω κῶλον τραγίσκιον (a game played at Tarentum).

children.label: II
children.definition: ornament in form of a goat, Inscr. Délos 461 Bb 19 (ii B. C.).

children.label: III
children.definition: a sea-fish, Marc.Sid. 23.

definition: τραγιστάς τοὺς τὰ ἱερεῖα κλέπτοντας, Hsch.

children.definition: goat-footed, of Pan, Sch. Ar. Ra. 232.
like a he-goat, Pl. Cra. 408d.
for shearing he-goats, μάχαιρα Luc. Pisc. 46.
of slaughtered goats, αἶμα E. Ba. 139 (lyr., -κτόνον codd.).
= Lat. tragula, Anon. ap. Suid.
with arm-pits smelling like a he-goat, Γοργόνες Ar. Pax 811.
hornbill, Mela 3.88, Plin. HN 10.136, Gloss.
goat-footed, Simon. 133, AP 6.315 ( Nicod.).
goat-faced, Suid. s.v. Μένδην.
gruel made from τράγος III, Cael.Aur. TP 3.2.
with a goatʼs beard, Cratin. 101 (but τραγοπώγωνος as nom. is cited from the same play in Sch. Il. POxy. 1087.37); cf. τετραπώγων.

children.label: II
children.definition: Subst., salsify, Tragopogon porrifolius, Thphr. HP 7.7.1, Dsc. 2.143.
goatʼs marjoram, Thymus Teucrioides, Nic. Al. 310, Cels. 5.11, Dsc. 3.30, Gal. 12.91: also neut. τραγορίγανον, Ps.- Dsc. 3.30, Cels. 3.21.7, Plin. HN 20.176:—
τρᾰγορῑγᾰνίτης [ῑτ] οἶνος wine flavoured therewith, Dsc. 5.45.

children.label: II
children.definition: τ. πλατύφυλλος organy, Origanum heracleoticum, Id. 3.30, Plin. HN 20.177.
